Theranos and Walgreens are taking the first step in making this service available to consumers with the first Theranos Wellness Center location opening this month at Walgreens drugstore at 300 University Ave. in Palo Alto, Calif., in the heart of Silicon Valley. The companies plan to offer the service at Walgreens locations nationwide. For the first time, Theranos is introducing CLIA-certified laboratory services with the ability to run its tests on micro-samples. Theranos' proprietary laboratory infrastructure minimizes human error through extensive automation to produce high quality results. Test results are available to physicians in a matter of hours, enabling fast diagnoses to help informed treatment choices. Theranos tests are low cost -- always 50% of Medicare reimbursement rates or less -- and are reimbursed by major insurance carriers, Medicare, and Medicaid. Developed to be accessible to everyone, Theranos tests cost the same amount for everyone, regardless of insurance plan or whether they are uninsured.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report August,2013 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Sep 05, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report August, 2013 sales/trading statement results on Sep 05, 2013

Key Development Headline: Missouri Attorney General Sues Walgreen, Alleging Deceptive Advertising
Key Development Situation: Missouri Attorney General Chris Koster said he filed a lawsuit against Walgreen Co. accusing the company of false and misleading advertising. The attorney general said that the company would display one price for a product while charging customers more at checkout.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Hosts Grand Opening of Mail Service Pharmacy and Customer Center
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark held a grand opening event on August 20, 2013, at its new Mail Service Pharmacy and Customer Center in Mt. Prospect, IL. The 150,000 square foot facility, representing an investment of approximately $67 million, supports pharmacy inventory and fulfillment needs across the CVS Caremark Pharmacy Benefit Management book of business, which serves approximately 60 million members throughout the United States. With the capability to fill 50 million prescriptions annually, this new facility is an example of CVS Caremark's continued investment and commitment to the State of Illinois. The new facility, which will employ more than 400 people by the end of 2013 including pharmacists, pharmacy technicians, automation technicians and process improvement engineers, balances the best of high tech automation and human expertise to streamline prescription fulfillment. Proprietary technology at the facility enables 90% of prescriptions to be dispensed and 80% of prescriptions to be packaged for mailing, using full automation. In addition, in order to further assure safe and accurate dispensing, all prescriptions are visually checked by one of the on-site pharmacists before they are mailed. The facility also includes a CVS Caremark Customer Center complete with a high-tech executive briefing room designed to introduce its clients and future partners to the full spectrum of CVS Caremark's integrated programs and services. Video and touch screen technology illustrate the CVS Caremark story and allows direct interaction with CVS retail pharmacists, specialty pharmacists and mail service pharmacists as well as Minute Clinic nurse practitioners via real-time telepresence technology.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Announces Amendments to its Bylaws
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. announced that its stockholders consented to amend the company's by-laws, as amended and restated, as set forth is: Section 6 of Article II of the Bylaws was amended to provide that the advance notice and information requirements associated with nominations of directors to the Board do not apply to the election of directors through action by written consent or at a special meeting. - Section 2 of Article III of the Bylaws was amended to provide that any vacancies on the Board may be filled by the stockholders and those vacancies resulting from a removal of directors by the stockholders shall be filled only by the stockholders.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Announces New Board of Directors
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. announced that a majority of its shareholders have appointed a new Board of Directors. The new members of the Company's Board of Directors are Steven Epstein, Mary Taylor Behrens, Kirk Gorman, Stephen Guillard, Joann Reed, John McCarty, Steven Shulman and Peter Urbanowicz.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Appoints Alex Gourlay as Executive Vice President, President of Customer Experience and Daily Living, Effective Oct. 1, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that Alex Gourlay, Chief Executive of the Health & Beauty Division, Alliance Boots, has been appointed as Walgreens Executive Vice President, President of Customer Experience and Daily Living, effective Oct. 1. In this new role reporting to Walgreens President and Chief Executive Officer Greg Wasson, Gourlay will lead an enhanced Walgreens Daily Living business operation overseeing customer experience, U.S. merchandising, marketing, customer insights, daily living products and promotions. The move follows the Walgreens and Alliance Boots strategic partnership announcement in June 2012, when the companies set forth a two-step process that would allow for the thoughtful integration of the two organizations. That process began at the end of 2012 with the establishment of a joint venture in Switzerland and the transition of key Walgreens and Alliance Boots executives to that entity. Gourlay's appointment to Walgreens advances the two companies' partnership, integration and synergies of businesses, talent and innovation.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Announces the Retirement of William H. Schoen as Director and Chairman of the Board, Effective from September 1, 2013
Key Development Situation: On August 7, 2013, Health Management Associates Inc. announced the retirement of William H. Schoen as director and Chairman of the Board of the company, effective as of September 1, 2013, or earlier if the consent solicitation by Glenview Capital Partners LLC is successful.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Plans to Opening of 150 Clinics for the Year End 2013
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced that expansion plans call for the opening of 150 clinics this year and to end 2013 with just under 800 clinics with around 30% of expansion this year in new markets.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report July,2013 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Aug 05, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report July, 2013 sales/trading statement results on Aug 05, 2013

Key Development Headline: HCA Seeks Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. (NYSE:HCA) seeks acquisitions. President Milton Johnson says HCA remains focused on possible deals in places where it already has a presence, and it's "actively pursuing acquisitions in markets that make sense to us."

Key Developments by Type: Executive/Board Changes - Other; Executive Changes - CEO
Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Names John M. Starcher as Interim President and Chief Executive Officer Effective August 1, 2013
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. announced that John M. Starcher Jr. has been named Interim President and Chief Executive Officer, effective August 1, 2013. Mr. Starcher currently serves as Health Management's Eastern Group President. Mr. Starcher, 43, joined Health Management as Eastern Group President in February 2012. Prior to joining Health Management, Mr. Starcher worked at Catholic Health Partners for 13 years, where he most recently served as a Division CEO, responsible for acute care hospitals and their affiliated clinical practices in northern Ohio, Kentucky, Pennsylvania and Tennessee.

Key Development Headline: HMA Mulls Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. (NYSE:HMA) is seeking acquisition opportunities. Due to the implementation of the Affordable Care Act, the company will continue to expand the depth and breadth of services in its existing markets and through acquisitions.

Key Development Headline: HCA's Bracken to Retire from CEO Role, to Remain as Board Chair
Key Development Situation: HCA announced that Richard M. Bracken will transition at the end of 2013 from his role as Chairman and CEO to Chairman of the Board. The Board of Directors has named R. Milton Johnson, HCA's President and CFO, his successor as Chief Executive Officer, effective at that same time. Bracken, who turns 61 in September, joined HCA in 1981 and since then, has held successive executive leadership roles within the Company. In 2002, he was named President and Chief Operating Officer and appointed to the Company's Board of Directors. He became CEO in 2009 and was appointed Chairman of the Board in December of 2013.

Key Development Headline: Hospital Corporation of America Announces Executive Changes
Key Development Situation: The AHA Board of Trustees has elected as its chair-elect designate Jonathan Perlin, M.D., president of clinical and physician services and chief medical officer for HCA (Hospital Corporation of America). He will assume the chairmanship in 2015. Before joining HCA, Perlin was Under Secretary for Health at the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, where he led the Veterans Health Administration.

Key Development Headline: Glenview Capital Management LLC Files Lawsuit Against Health Management Associates Inc
Key Development Situation: Glenview Capital Management LLC filed a lawsuit, alleging Health Management Associates Inc. is wrongly rejecting a plan to replace its board. Glenview owns 14.6% of HMA stock and believes the board should be removed due to HMA's poor financial performance. In the suit filed in Delaware Chancery Court, Glenview said the directors are refusing to give up provisions in lender agreements that would force HMA to make accelerated payments of its $3.5 billion in debt if the board is removed.

Key Development Headline: Harrisburg Pharmacist Sues CVS Caremark
Key Development Situation: A Harrisburg pharmacist has sued CVS Caremark in federal court, alleging that the company discriminated against him because he had multiple sclerosis and fired him because he raised safety concerns about CVS's plans to cut staff. In the lawsuit, filed in Harrisburg, Joseph Zorek, announced that he had worked for the company or its predecessors from 1968 until 2012, when, he said, he was fired. Zorek's suit announced that CVS violated the American With Disabilities Act for several years when supervisors insisted he use a lift chair not meant for long-term sitting, so that he could see the floor in front of the pharmacy counter. Zorek announced that he was in charge of the pharmacy, worked 50 to 60 hours per week, and supervised four staff pharmacists and 21 pharmacy technicians. In 2010 and 2011, the suit says, that 24-hour pharmacy dispensed about 4,200 prescriptions per week, more than any other CVS store in its sales district. In an effort to increase profits, defendants cut the number of pharmacy technician hours by nearly 20%, according to the suit. Zorek warned his supervisors that cutting staff would increase errors in the labeling and filling of prescriptions, and, the suit says, that prediction proved true after the cuts were made.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens Names Mark Lelinski as Corporate Vice President of Market Access
Key Development Situation: Walgreens has named Mark Lelinski as its new corporate vice president, market access. Lelinski will be responsible for contracting and pricing strategies, integration efforts across Walgreens pharmacy, health and wellness division, sales and account management, and overseeing the continued evolution of the company's managed market strategies. He joined Walgreens on June 17. Lelinski previously spent nine years with AstraZeneca in a number of marketing, strategy and managed market roles, both in the U.S. and abroad. In his most recent role as vice president, Americas region marketing and sales, Lelinski was responsible for implementing new commercial capabilities across markets in the U.S., Canada and Latin America. He also led efforts to build new capabilities in Latin America to improve both market access and patient affordability for the emerging middle class. As vice president, U.S. managed markets, Lelinski led all aspects of payer strategy, B2B marketing, account management, contracting and pricing with all payer customers.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens Expands Vaccine Availability at 204 Locations Across Indiana
Key Development Situation: Walgreens has expanded vaccine availability at all of its 204 locations across Indiana. With vaccine available at all Walgreens pharmacies in Indiana, patients age 11 and older do not require a prescription for Influenza, Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis (Tdap), Human papillomavirus (HPV), or Meningococcal vaccines. In addition, patients age 65 and older will no longer need a prescription for Pneumococcal vaccine. Flu shots will also be available beginning in August, the company added.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Names Eva C. Boratto as Senior Vice President Controller and Chief Accounting Officer
Key Development Situation: On July 10, 2013, Eva C. Boratto, Senior Vice President PBM Finance, was named as Senior Vice President Controller and Chief Accounting Officer of CVS Caremark Corporation, effective immediately. Ms. Boratto is assuming the Controller and CAO roles from David M. Denton, company’s Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, who had assumed those additional roles in May 2013. Mr. Denton will remain Executive Vice President and CFO of the company. Ms. Boratto has served as the company’s Senior Vice President PBM Finance since July 2010. Previously, she served in a number of executive positions during nearly 20 years at Merck & Co. Inc., most recently as Vice President U.S. Market Finance Leader from June 2009 to July 2010 and Vice President Investor Relations from April 2008 to June 2009.

Key Development Headline: HCA Announces Executive Changes
Key Development Situation: HCA announced that James C. Scoggin, Jr., President of the company's North Texas Division, will retire effective October 1, 2013. Erol R. Akdamar, who currently is Chief Executive Officer of HCA's Medical City Dallas Hospital, will replace Scoggin. Scoggin, is a 26-year veteran of HCA who has served as President of the North Texas Division, which includes 14 hospitals in the Dallas-Fort Worth and Oklahoma City markets, since 2006. A 20-year HCA and hospital industry veteran, Akdamar, has served as CEO of 677-bed Medical City Dallas Hospital, since 2010. Prior to that, Akdamar was CEO of St. David's South Austin Medical Center in Austin, Texas. The company also announced the retirement of North Texas Division Chief Financial Officer Thomas O. Corley, effective December 31, 2013. During his 34-year career with the company, Corley served in a number of hospital and multi-facility leadership positions.

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Inc. Reaches Lawsuit Settlement
Key Development Situation: Amedisys Inc. has reached a preliminary settlement with shareholders who filed a federal lawsuit alleging that some executives engaged in insider trading, approved or made false statements to shareholders and unjustly enriched themselves at the company's expense. The company and its executives denied the allegations and continue to do so, according to records in U.S. District Court in Baton Rouge. Under the preliminary agreement, the company will pay up to $445,000 in attorneys' fees and expenses. The amount will include $5,000 to each of the plaintiffs. Ten separate lawsuits were filed but they were consolidated. A hearing on whether Judge Brian Jackson should give final approval to the settlement has been set for 9:30 a.m. September 4, 2013 at the court.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report June,2013 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Jul 03, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report June, 2013 sales/trading statement results on Jul 03, 2013

Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates, Inc. Chosen by Southeast Volusia Hospital District Board of Commissioners to Lease Bert Fish Medical Center
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. announced that it has been selected by the Southeast Volusia Hospital District Board of Commissioners to begin exclusive negotiations toward a lease agreement for the 112-bed Bert Fish Medical Center in New Smyrna Beach, Florida. Bert Fish Medical Center would join Health Management's network in Florida, which currently includes 23 hospitals, and a statewide clinical affiliation with the University of Florida's affiliated teaching hospital, Shands Hospital.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Expand Solar Energy Installations to More Than 200 Stores
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will build more than 200 new solar installations at Walgreens drugstores throughout California, Connecticut, Delaware, Massachusetts, New Jersey and New York. This latest expansion will bring the number of completed solar installations at Walgreens stores to more than 350. The upcoming rollout will produce an estimated 13.5 million kilowatt hours annually, the equivalent of offsetting the CO2 emissions from the electricity use of more than 1,400 homes for one year. Included in the rollout is the Walgreens net-zero energy, LEED Platinum store in Evanston, Ill., which will feature more than 850 roof-top solar panels.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Announces Executive Changes
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark appointed Marissa Schlaifer as head of policy and Judy Chong as senior adviser of public affairs.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Launches Management Services Division
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. announced the addition of managerial and operational support offerings to hospitals located in existing markets but currently unaffiliated with Health Management.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Signs Letter of Intent to Lease Munroe Regional Medical Center
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. announced that it has executed a letter of intent, under which it would enter into a long-term lease with Munroe Regional Medical Center and bring Munroe Regional into Health Management's clinical affiliation with University of Florida Health Shands Hospital. The letter of intent marks the beginning of the due diligence process between Munroe Regional, Health Management and UF Health Shands Hospital toward a definitive agreement. The three parties expect to execute the definitive agreement by the fourth quarter of 2013, and to complete the new partnership before the end of the year. During this time, the parties will seek all necessary state and local government regulatory approvals.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens Wins Judgment in Miami-Dade County Circuit Court
Key Development Situation: Walgreens won the judgment in Miami-Dade County Circuit Court against Dr. Siegal's Direct Nutritionals, a company headed by Dr. Sanford Siegal who has been selling his line of diet cookies since 1975. The lawsuit concerns a 2009 agreement between Siegal and Walgreens in which he guaranteed sales on all products sold at Walgreens. Walgreens purchased over $5.4 million in Siegal's cookies and the company is owed the $2.6 million, plus interest, for products that went unsold.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report May,2013 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Jun 05, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report May, 2013 sales/trading statement results on Jun 05, 2013

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Mulls To Sell 35 care centers
Key Development Situation: Amedisys Inc. (NasdaqGS:AMED) retained the services of The Braff Group to assist in the divestiture of approximately 35 care centers.

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Mulls Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: Universal Health Services Inc. (NYSE:UHS) is seeking acquisition opportunities. “I think a lot of our focus over the next few years is going to be devoted to seeing to what degree we can get control of as many of those beds as possible, meaning through tuck-in acquisitions , one-offs, two-offs, trying to get more penetration in the acute-care space, getting to their beds, managing their beds, leasing their beds, partnering with them to joint venture beds, you know, all those sorts of opportunities,” Steve Filton, Chief Financial Officer of Universal Health, said at Deutsche Bank dbAccess Health Care Conference.

Key Development Headline: HCA Holdings, Inc. Announces a Comprehensive Infection Prevention Study
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. announced a comprehensive infection prevention study, conducted exclusively at 43 HCA-affiliated hospitals, has been published in the New England Journal of Medicine. The study, known as Randomized Evaluation of Decolonization Versus Universal Clearance to Eliminate (REDUCE) MRSA, was conducted in conjunction with investigators at Harvard and several other academic institutions, and research programs at two U.S. Department of Health and Human Services agencies, the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The use of antimicrobial agents on an entire patient population is referred to as universal decolonization. The study found that using antimicrobial soap and ointment to decolonize all intensive care unit patients reduces all bloodstream infections, including MRSA by 44%. The findings suggest a major change in healthcare practice that could save lives. As a result of the findings, HCA is in the process of implementing universal decolonization in its adult intensive care units at its affiliated hospitals. The study, which involved nearly 75,000 patients and more than 280,000 patient days in 74 adult ICUs located in 16 states, compared the results of three approaches in ICUs: Screen all patients and isolate MRSA carriers; Targeted decolonization: screening, isolation, and decolonization of MRSA carriers with chlorhexidine and mupirocin ointment; Universal decolonization: no screening and all patients decolonized with chlorhexidine and nasal mupirocin ointment.

Key Developments by Type: Executive/Board Changes - Other; Executive Changes - CEO
Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Announces Retirement of Gary D. Newsome as President, Chief Executive Officer and Member of the Board of Directors, Effective July 31, 2013
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc.'s Board of Directors announced that Gary D. Newsome will retire as President, Chief Executive Officer and member of the Board of Directors, effective July 31, 2013. Mr. Newsome will continue to lead the company until his retirement and the Board has initiated a search for a new Chief Executive Officer. Mr. Newsome has been called by the First Presidency of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints to serve as the President of its Uruguay-Montevideo Mission in South America.

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Services Inc. Plans to Open its Fourth Hospital in the Riverside County California
Key Development Situation: Universal Health Services Inc. plans to open its fourth hospital in the Riverside County California market in Temecula in the third or fourth quarter of 2013, helping to sort of cement its franchise in that portion of the Temecula market.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Seeks Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: Rick Hans, Divisional Vice President, Investor Relations & Finance of Walgreen Co. (NYSE:WAG) (Walgreen) said at the Bank of America-Merrill Lynch Healthcare Conference that they will use some cash for internal growth and for some minor tuck-in acquisitions.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Approves Amendment of its Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation approved the amendment of the company's amended and restated certificate of incorporation to reduce the voting thresholds in the fair price provision in the annual general meeting held on May 09, 2013.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Announces Board Changes
Key Development Situation: On May 9, 2013, CVS Caremark Corporation held its 2013 Annual Meeting of Stockholders. At the time of the Annual Meeting, Directors Marian L. Heard and Lance Piccolo did not stand for re-election and retired from the company's Board of Directors. Accordingly, by vote of the Board of Directors, the size of the Board was reduced from 11 to 9 members. On May 9, 2013, the Board of Directors of the company appointed William C. Weldon to its Management Planning and Development Committee and its Nominating and Corporate Goverence Committee. Mr. Weldon had been elected to the Board by the Board of Directors of the company in March 2013 and was reelected by the stockholders of the company on May 9, 2013.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens Extends CVS Caremark Network Provider Agreement
Key Development Situation: Walgreens announced it has extended its agreement as a network pharmacy provider in the CVS Caremark pharmacy benefit management (PBM) national retail network.

Key Development Headline: HCA Holdings, Inc. Announces Board Changes
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. elected Ann Huntress Lamont, Managing Partner of Oak Investment Partners, to the board, effective immediately. Ms. Lamont will also serve as a member of the company's Compensation Committee and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee. Messrs. Michael W. Michelson and Stephen G. Pagliuca have resigned from membership on the company's Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee effective upon the appointment of Ms. Lamont to the committee.

Key Development Headline: Hanger, Inc. Elects Thomas P. Cooper as Non-Executive Chairman of the Board of Directors
Key Development Situation: The Board of Directors of Hanger, Inc. elected Thomas P. Cooper, M.D. to the position of non-executive Chairman of the Board of Directors at the board meeting immediately following Hanger's Annual Meeting of Shareholders in Austin, TX. A member of the board since 1991, Dr. Cooper served as the lead independent director prior to this election. A member of the boards of Kindred Healthcare, Inc. and IPC The Hospitalist Company, Inc., Dr. Cooper has founded and led a number of healthcare-related businesses including Correctional Medical Systems, Spectrum Emergency Care, and Mobilex. In addition, he has served as an Adjunct Professor at the Columbia University School of Business.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens to Debut San Francisco Store on May 8 at the Corner of Powell and O'Farrell
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced the official opening of its newest store, located at Powell and O'Farrell streets in the heart of San Francisco's Union Square neighborhood. The store, which will open at 10 a.m. May 8, features an extensive collection of innovative offerings and services unexpected from a drugstore. This expanded store is tailored to reflect the uniqueness of San Francisco, at a location where Walgreens has been present since 1946. The store's expanded features include: A LOOK Boutique beauty department featuring dozens of prestige and niche cosmetic, skincare and hair care brands not typically found in drugstores. As part of it, Britain's leading skincare and cosmetics brand No7, created by Boots, will be available. No7 is well known for its internationally acclaimed range of anti-aging beauty serums, all independently scientifically tested. Specially-trained beauty advisors are on hand to offer guidance finding the best solutions for individual needs. Expert BROW shaping and grooming services will be available at the Ramy Eyebrow Bar. Hundreds of fresh food items including produce and high-quality, on-the-go meal options such as wraps, sandwiches and salads made fresh daily. A Coca-Cola Freestyle machine dispensing 130 varieties of Coca Cola fountain drinks. Several flavors of self-serve frozen yogurt accompanied by an enticing toppings bar. An Upmarket Café offering a barista preparing fresh brewed premium coffee and espressos. Local, freshly baked goods also are available. A juice and smoothie bar featuring fresh fruits and vegetables included in distinct recipes. A robust selection of beer, wine and spirits and quality products appropriate to celebrate special occasions. A replica display of Ghirardelli Square that will pay homage to Ghirardelli's local history and will offer one of the selections of Ghirardelli premium chocolates and gift selections in the San Francisco area.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report April,2013 Sales/Trading Statement Results on May 03, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report April, 2013 sales/trading statement results on May 03, 2013

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Appoints Laird K. Daniels as Senior Vice President – International Operations and Business Development, Effective Immediately
Key Development Situation: On May 1, 2013, CVS Caremark Corporation announced that Laird K. Daniels, formerly Senior Vice President – Controller and Chief Accounting Officer, has assumed the role of Senior Vice President – International Operations and Business Development, effective immediately. In his new role Mr. Daniels will report directly to the company’s President and Chief Executive Officer.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens to Debut Boston Store on May 1 at Corner of School and Washington
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. will celebrate the official opening of its newest store, located at School and Washington streets in Boston. The store, which will open at 10 a.m. on May 1, features an extensive collection of innovative offerings, products and services unexpected from a drugstore. The store's expanded features include an enhanced, pharmacy designed to encourage greater interaction between pharmacists and patients. At the core of this approach is an effort to bring the pharmacist out from behind the counter so they can provide more counseling to patients, offer clinical services and answer questions.

Key Development Headline: Medhost Sues Health Management Associates Inc
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates owes more than $4.5 million to a Texas company for emergency room software that it is still using. HMA signed a contract with Medhost for its emergency room software in May, 2011. The contract and the amount of the contract wasn't included in the complaint. The terms enabled HMA to test the software at its Seven Rivers Regional Medical Center in Crystal River, near Tampa. From there, HMA was to notify Medhost of any shortcomings within five days of a 60-day trial period ending. The complaint said HMA didn't submit a list of any problems and the software was installed at all of the company's 58 hospitals. HMA paid the first two installments to Medhost, the amounts of which aren't disclosed in the complaint, but didn't pay the third installment of $4.5 million. The third installment was due Sept. 30, 2012. Medhost notified HMA of the contract breach on Feb. 4, 2013, and the hospital operator failed to make the payment, according to the complaint. HMA continues to use the software and submitted two additional orders to add it at 10 more hospitals. To date, the software has been installed at eight of the 10 hospitals. Filing the complaint was done as a last resort after ongoing conversations with HMA since last year.

Key Development Headline: HCA Holdings, Inc. Elects Jeff Myers as Director
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. announced that at the 2013 Annual Meeting of Stockholders elected Jeff Myers as director until the 2014. Mr. Myers is the past -- retired Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President and Treasurer for Manor Care, Inc.

Key Development Headline: SL Green Realty Corp. and The Moinian Group Signs 15-Year Lease with CVS Caremark Corporation
Key Development Situation: SL Green Realty Corp. and The Moinian Group on April 24, 2013 announced that CVS Caremark Corporation has signed a new 15-year lease for 21,159 square feet covering the vacant portion of the ground and a portion of the second floors at 3 Columbus Circle, the 768,565-square-foot office building formerly known as 1775 Broadway. Occupying the entire block between Broadway and Eighth Avenue, the newly-redeveloped, 26-story building commands a premier Westside location, steps from the roundabout at Columbus Circle. SL Green together with partner, The Moinian Group, recently completed a building-wide redevelopment that includes a new glass façade, relocated and expanded lobby, new elevators, new bathrooms, electric distribution and extensive HVAC, security and related infrastructure upgrades. The building's anchor office tenant is the world headquarters for Young & Rubicam. Jason Pruger, Newmark Grubb Knight Frank represented CVS in the transaction, while Jeff Winick of Winick Realty Group acted on behalf of the landlord.

Key Development Headline: Marion County Hospital District Trustees Chooses Health Management Associates Inc. to Lease Munroe Regional Medical Center
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. announced that it has been selected by the Trustees of the Marion County Hospital District to begin exclusive negotiations towards a long term lease agreement under which it will operate 421-bed Munroe Regional Medical Center located in Ocala, Florida.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Seeks Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. seeks acquisitions. "Our partnership and acquisition pipeline remains very active. We have several excellent opportunities currently under review and negotiation. We are hopeful that we'll have additional new development announcements to share with you over the course of the next several months. As you can tell, there are many exciting opportunities ahead of us. We are well on our way to being prepared for the implementation of the ACA and the launch of exchanges in January 2014," said Gary Newsome, President and Chief Executive Officer, Health Management Associates, Inc.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report March,2013 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Apr 03, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report March, 2013 sales/trading statement results on Apr 03, 2013

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Puts a Store in the Wrigley Building
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. is putting a store in the Wrigley Building. The drugstore chain is negotiating a lease for space expected to be about 30,000 square feet at the property located at 400-410 N. Michigan Ave. The building is being renovated at this time.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens Extends its Renewable Energy Commitment to 22 Stores in Colorado with SolarCity
Key Development Situation: Walgreens announced an expansion of its renewable energy initiative to Colorado with SolarCity. SolarCity will implement solar systems at 22 Walgreens stores across 14 different cities in Colorado in the coming months. The new solar systems cumulatively will reduce more than 47.5 million pounds of carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the next 20 years, which is comparable to planting 25,711 trees.

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Services Inc. Appoints Eileen C. McDonnell to its Board of Directors
Key Development Situation: Universal Health Services Inc. announced that Eileen C. McDonnell has been appointed to its Board of Directors. Ms. McDonnell becomes the seventh member of the Board of Directors. Ms. McDonnell currently serves as President and Chief Executive Officer of The Penn Mutual Life Insurance Company since her appointment to that position in February, 2011. She joined Penn Mutual in 2008 and previously served as President of the company. Ms. McDonnell was also appointed to The Penn Mutual Board of Trustees in 2010. Previously, she was president of New England Financial and senior vice president of the Guardian Life Insurance Company.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Elects William C. Weldon to Serve on the Board
Key Development Situation: On March 29, 2013, the Board of Directors of CVS Caremark Corporation elected William C. Weldon to serve on the Board. Mr. Weldon, age 64, is the former Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer of Johnson & Johnson, having served in those positions from 2002 until his retirement as Chief Executive Officer in April 2012 and his retirement from the board in December 2012. Mr. Weldon previously served in a variety of senior executive positions during his 41-year career with Johnson & Johnson. He is also a director of JPMorgan Chase & Co.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Open New Store in the Iconic Empire State Building
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that the company will open its latest New York City-based store located in the world renowned Empire State Building. The store, which opens to the public at 10 a.m., features an extensive collection of innovative offerings, products and services unexpected from a drugstore. The store's expanded features include: An enhanced pharmacy designed to encourage greater interaction between pharmacists and patients. A health guide will help pharmacy customers navigate a wide range of health and wellness products, as well as healthcare services including immunizations and health tests to better manage patient care. The pharmacy also features an 'Ask Your Pharmacist' desk, private consultation rooms and Express Rx kiosks for easy, self-serve checkout. A LOOK Boutique beauty department featuring dozens of prestige and niche cosmetic, skincare and hair care brands not typically found in drugstores. Specially-trained beauty advisors are on hand to offer guidance finding the best solutions for individual needs. Expert shaping and grooming services will be available at the Eyebrow Bar. Hundreds of fresh food items including produce and high-quality, on-the-go meal options such as wraps, sandwiches and salads made fresh daily. A Coca-Cola Freestyle machine dispensing 130 varieties of Coca Cola fountain drinks. Customers can also enjoy several flavors of self-serve frozen yogurt accompanied by an enticing toppings bar. An Up market Café offering fresh brewed coffee, pastries, doughnuts and bagels.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens to Open New Well Experience Store, in Washington, D.C
Key Development Situation: Walgreens announced that it will open new Well Experience store, located in Washington, D.C. at 7th Street and H Street, NW. The store, which opens at 9:30 a.m. on March 21, 2013 showcases a unique pharmacy format that provides comprehensive care such as health tests and immunizations, as well as health and daily living offerings like fresh food and an enhanced beauty department. The store's expanded features include: An enhanced, pharmacy designed to encourage greater interaction between pharmacists and patients. An iPad equipped health guide will help pharmacy customers navigate a wide range of health and wellness products, services and resources including immunizations and health tests. The pharmacy also features an 'Ask Your Pharmacist' desk, consultation rooms and Express Rx kiosks for swift checkout. A Take Care Clinic offering a wide range of health care services including vaccinations, health tests, physicals and treatments for common illnesses and minor injuries. Aligned with the store opening, Walgreens and Bausch + Lomb recently announced a new SightSense(TM) online and in-store patient education program -- an initiative to heighten eye health awareness and encourage consumers to take proactive steps to protect and preserve their sight. The program features a special eye health section on Walgreens.com that provides tools, information and resources to help consumers become informed and proactive in their eye health. The website also provides an eye care professional locator for consumers to find an eye doctor near them, as well as a list of upcoming in-store events. A LOOK Boutique beauty department featuring dozens of prestige and niche cosmetic, skincare and hair care brands not typically found in drugstores. Customers can also enjoy several flavors of self-serve frozen yogurt accompanied by an enticing toppings bar. An Upmarket Café offering a barista preparing fresh brewed premium coffee and espressos. A juice and smoothie bar featuring fresh fruits and vegetables included in distinct recipes.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Announces Several Updates to its Mobile App
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced several updates to its mobile app, most notably the ability to print from Instagram, as well as upload more than five pictures simultaneously for in-store prints. The updates apply to iPhones, iPads and Android devices. In addition to the robust functionality available, the specific updates include: Print from Instagram: Easily print Instagram photo creations to a local Walgreens for pick up in about an hour; QuickPrints: Users can now upload more than five pictures at a time to send to their local Walgreens for prints; MedHelp: Access to a helpful health reference encyclopedia, track your weight loss, BMI and much more.

Key Development Headline: Ivan R. Sabel Not to Stand for Re-Election as Director of Hanger, Inc
Key Development Situation: On March 15, 2013, Ivan R. Sabel, the non-executive Chairman of the Board of Directors of Hanger, Inc. informed the Board that he will not stand for re-election as a director of the company at the expiration of his current term, which expires at the Company’s Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held May 9, 2013.

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Inc. Appoints Linda J. Hall to the Board
Key Development Situation: Amedisys Inc. announced that Ms. Linda J. Hall has joined the board. Ms. Hall is the Entrepreneur-in-Residence at the Carlson School of Management at the University of Minnesota, and she works as a private consultant with several companies, including a number of companies in the healthcare industry.

Key Development Headline: Leatrice Ducat Resigns as Director from Universal Health Services, Inc
Key Development Situation: On March 6, 2013, Universal Health Services Inc. received notification from Leatrice Ducat that she has decided to resign from the Board of Directors, effective immediately.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report February,2013 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Mar 05, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report February, 2013 sales/trading statement results on Mar 05, 2013

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Services Inc. Hires Lynda Ann Smirz as Vice President and Chief Medical Officer, Acute Care Division
Key Development Situation: Universal Health Services Inc. hired Lynda Ann Smirz as vice president and chief medical officer, Acute Care Division. She had been chief medical officer, vice president of surgical services, with the IU Health System at IU Health North in Indianapolis.

Key Development Headline: StudioCanal Files Suit against Universal
Key Development Situation: StudioCanal filed suit against Universal, claiming that they are owed tens of millions and "likely much more" after doing an audit of their partnership to make movies under the working title films banner. The suit, filed in Los Angeles Superior Court, seeks unspecified damages, as well as a private arbitration Studio Canal said is required through its partnership agreement. StudioCanal claims that U "intentionally hid from the partnership and kept for itself" returns from off-balance-sheet financing arrangements, that the studio reported "negligible" amounts from ancillary revenue like music publishing; retained for itself the financial benefits from vendors and "double charged' the partnership for producing and other fees paid to Working Title. In addition, StudioCanal claims that U deducted millions in "unsubstantiated expenses" before reporting results to its partner. StudioCanal said that it filed suit after conducting an audit, but that it only covered six of the joint venture's 44 movies and focused on only a few territories. The suit said that its efforts to resolve the situation with U execs has been rebuffed, with the studio failing to provide requested documents and having halted sending accounting statements. "In short, Universal is behaving as if its partner StudioCanal does not even exist".

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Appoints Brian Tilzer as Senior Vice President, Chief Digital Officer
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced the appointment of Brian Tilzer to the position of Senior Vice President, Chief Digital Officer. Tilzer will develop and lead teams driving CVS Caremark's company-wide digital innovation efforts. Tilzer will focus on connecting current and future digital initiatives and ensuring that CVS Caremark continues to use the most innovative technology available to seamlessly meet customers' needs. Tilzer has more than 20 years of experience in strategic business development, operations and information technology, with a deep concentration in corporate and e-commerce strategy. Prior to joining CVS Caremark, he was the Senior Vice President of Global e-Commerce with Staples.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Announces Executive Changes
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced the resignation of Joseph C. Magnacca as Executive Vice President and President, Daily Living Products and Solutions to become Chief Executive Officer of RadioShack Corporation. W. Bryan Pugh, Vice President of Well Experience Deployment, will lead on an interim basis the Company’s daily living and merchandising operations, reporting to Mark A. Wagner, President of Operations and Community Management.

Key Developments by Type: Corporate Guidance - Raised; Announcements of Earnings; Corporate Guidance - New/Confirmed; Business Expansions
Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Reports Unaudited Consolidated Earnings Results for the Fourth Quarter and Full Year Ended December 31, 2012; Provides Earnings Guidance for the First Quarter Ended March 31, 2013; Revised Earnings Guidance for Full Year Ending December 31, 2013; Expects to Open Another 150 Clinics in 2013
Key Development Situation:
CVS Caremark Corporation reported unaudited consolidated earnings results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2012. For the quarter, the company reported net revenues of $31,394 million against $28,317 million a year ago. Operating profit was $2,302 million against $1,957 million a year ago. Income before income tax provision was $1,795 million against $1,810 million a year ago. Income from continuing operations was $1,129 million against $1,099 million a year ago. Net income attributable to company was $1,129 million or $0.90 per diluted share against $1,064 million or $0.81 per diluted share a year ago. Adjusted income before income tax provision was $1,919 million against $1,924 million a year ago. Adjusted income from continuing operations was $1,206 million against $1,168 million a year ago. Adjusted income from continuing operations attributable to company was $1,206 million or $0.97 per diluted share against $1,169 million or $0.89 per diluted share a year ago. The increase in income from continuing operations was primarily driven by improved operating profit in both pharmacy services and retail pharmacy segments. EBITDA was $1,172 million against $840 million a year ago. EBITDA per adjusted claim was $4.44 million against $3.45 million a year ago. Gross capital expenditures of $716 million were offset by $102 million of sale-leaseback activity.

For the year, the company reported net revenues of $123,133 million against $107,100 million a year ago. Operating profit was $7,228 million against $6,330 million a year ago. Income before income tax provision was $6,323 million against $5,746 million a year ago. Income from continuing operations was $3,882 million against $3,488 million a year ago. Net income attributable to company was $3,877 million or $3.03 per diluted share against $3,492 million or $2.57 per diluted share a year ago. Adjusted income before income tax provision was $6,809 million against $6,198 million a year ago. Adjusted income from continuing operations was $4,181 million against $3,762 million a year ago. Adjusted income from continuing operations attributable to company was $4,183 million or $3.27 per diluted share against $3,766 million or $2.80 per diluted share a year ago. Net cash provided by operating activities was $6,671 million against $5,856 million a year ago. Purchases of property and equipment were $2,030 million against $1,872 million a year ago. EBITDA was $3,196 million against $2,653 million a year ago. EBITDA per adjusted claim was $3.09 million against $2.93 million a year ago. Net capital expenditures were $1.5 billion, which included $2 billion of gross CapEx, offset by $529 million in sale-leaseback proceeds. 


The company provided earnings results for the first quarter ended March 31, 2013. For the quarter, the company expects income before income tax provision to be in range of $1,442 million to $1,502 million, adjusted income before income tax provision to be in range of $1,562 million against $1,622 million, adjusted income from continuing operations to be in range of $953 million to $989 million, adjusted income from continuing operations attributable to company to be in range of $953 million or $0.77 per diluted share to $989 million or $0.80 per diluted share. GAAP diluted EPS from continued operations is expected to be in the range of $0.71 to $0.74 per share. 


The company raised earnings guidance for full year ending December 31, 2013. For the period, the company expects income before income tax provision to be in range of $7,188 million to $7,444 million, adjusted income before income tax provision to be in range of $7,673 million against $7,929 million, adjusted income from continuing operations to be in range of $4,688 million to $4,845 million, adjusted income from continuing operations attributable to company to be in range of $4,688 million or $3.86 per diluted share to $4,845 million or $4.00 per diluted share, net cash provided by operating activities to be $6,350 million to $6,649 million and free cash flow expects to be in range of $4,800 million to $5,100 million. GAAP diluted EPS from continuing operations is expected to be in the range of $3.61 to $3.75 per share. The company continues to expect consolidated net revenue growth of 0.75% to 2%.


The company expects to open another 150 clinics in 2013, ending with just under 800 clinics.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report January,2013 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Feb 05, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report January, 2013 sales/trading statement results on Feb 05, 2013

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Announces Availability of New Application Programming Interface
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. is making available a new application programming interface (API) that allows third-party mobile app developers to integrate the drugstore chain's prescription refill technology. Developers who have scanning functionality within their apps can easily integrate the API to enable their users to order a prescription refill by scanning the barcode on a Walgreens prescription bottle. 11% of hospital admissions and 40% of nursing home admissions are attributable to medication non-adherence, which has been estimated to cost the U.S. health care system $290 billion annually. In addition to tools such as Refill by Scan, Walgreens pharmacists can significantly improve adherence to medications through face-to-face interaction and counseling. One recent study demonstrated a nearly 5% increase in adherence rates among patients who received regular counseling from their pharmacist over the course of a year. The Walgreens Prescription API marks the first time such technology is available for adoption among mobile app developers who focus on health and wellness, and it is the second API program offered by Walgreens. Last year, Walgreens launched its QuickPrints SDK and API, which provided third-party developers with the ability to integrate in-store photo services for its users. The Walgreens Prescription API has been adopted by several app developers including Healthspek and PocketPharmacist.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation to Expand Beauty Brand Presence
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark has teamed up with Boldface Group, to expand the Kardashian Sisters' Beauty Brand presence to 2,100 outlets after an initial launch of the company's limited edition Holiday line. Under the deal, CVS Caremark will showcase its newly launching products on power-wing units, placed in the beauty areas at CVS/pharmacy stores as of March 2013. The full launch assortment includes four mascara offerings, Joystick long lasting moisturizing lipstick and Honey Sticks wild honey flavored lip gloss.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens Promotes Joseph Magnacca from Senior Vice President to Executive Vice President, Effective February 1, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreens announced the promotion of Joseph Magnacca from senior vice president to executive vice president, effective February 1, 2013. Magnacca also retains his title as president of daily living products and solutions. Magnacca oversees Walgreens merchandising and inventory strategy, private brands, insights and analytics, and Duane Reade drugstore chain. A retail industry veteran of more than 20 years, Magnacca joined Duane Reade in 2008 as senior vice president and chief merchandising officer. Joseph was later promoted to executive vice president at Duane Reade and then to president of the drugstore chain following its acquisition by Walgreens. Joseph was named Walgreens president of daily living products and solutions in 2011.

Key Development Headline: LHC Group, Inc. Names Jeffrey Kreger Senior Vice President of Finance
Key Development Situation: LHC Group, Inc. has selected a proven executive with extensive experience at publicly traded healthcare organizations to serve as the company's senior vice president of finance. Jeffrey M. Kreger, a certified public accountant, brings more than two decades of financial, operational and administrative experience to his new role. He will report directly to Peter J. Roman, executive vice president and chief financial officer, and will oversee all accounting, reporting and cash management functions for LHC Group and will manage the company's relationship with its bank group. Most recently, Kreger served as senior vice president and corporate controller for Sun Healthcare Group Inc.

Key Development Headline: MyMedicalRecords Files Patent Infringement Complaint against Walgreen Co
Key Development Situation: MyMedicalRecords Inc. announced the filing of a complaint for patent infringement against Walgreen Co. The complaint alleges that Walgreens is infringing on MMR's Personal Health Records patent, specifically U.S. Patent No. 8,301,466, and as a result, MMR is seeking monetary damages as well as a permanent injunction. As stated in the complaint, Walgreens is the nation's large drugstore chain with fiscal 2012 sales of $72 billion, operating 8061 drugstores and providing services to over 6 million customers. The complaint was filed in the United States District Court for the Central District of California, case number CV 13-00631, on January 29.

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Services Inc. Announces Resignation of Richard C. Wright as Vice President-Development, Effective as of January 31, 2013
Key Development Situation: Universal Health Services Inc. announced the resignation of Richard C. Wright from his position as Vice President-Development, effective as of January 31, 2013. Mr. Wright will continue as an employee of a wholly-owned subsidiary of the company until he retires on February 28, 2013.

Key Development Headline: Judge Orders HCA Holdings, Inc. to Pay $162 Million to Missouri Foundation
Key Development Situation: A judge has ordered HCA Holdings, Inc. to pay $162 million to a Missouri foundation for failing to make improvements to hospitals it bought in the Kansas City area. The case goes back to HCA Holdings' purchase of 12 hospitals from Health Midwest in 2003 for $1.13 billion. As part of the deal, HCA Holdings agreed to make $450 million in capital improvements over five years and agreed to maintain existing levels of care for low-income patients. A judge ruled that HCA Holdings did not live up to its capital improvement obligations and ordered a court-appointed accountant to determine whether HCA Holdings maintained the agreed-to levels of charitable care. The company plans to appeal the ruling.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Declares Regular Quarterly Dividend, Payable March 12, 2013; Elects Ted Heidloff as Controller, Replacing Mia Scholz
Key Development Situation:
The board of directors of Walgreen Co. declared a regular quarterly dividend of 27.5 cents per share, a 22.2% increase over the year ago dividend. The dividend is payable March 12, 2013, to shareholders of record Feb. 15, 2013. The company annual dividend rate has increased from 38 cents per share to $1.10 per share, resulting in a compound annual growth rate of nearly 24%.

The company's board elected Ted Heidloff as controller of the company. Heidloff succeeds Mia Scholz, who continues in her role with Walgreens as senior vice president of corporate financial operations.

Key Development Headline: Res-Care Inc. Selects Walgreen Co. Prescription Services to Offer New DailyMed
Key Development Situation: Res-Care Inc. announced that it has signed a national affiliation agreement with Walgreens as the national drugstore chain rolls out its DailyMed by Walgreens(TM) prescription service. DailyMed by Walgreens(TM) offers a safe and effective way for patients to organize and keep track of multiple medications, with individual, pre-sorted packets that indicate date and time certain medications are scheduled to be taken. A service that's ideal for some seniors and other patients with complex prescription regimens, DailyMed provides a 30-day supply of certain medications, with sealed and clearly marked packets that eliminate the need to sort through multiple prescriptions with different daily dosages and timing. DailyMed by Walgreens(TM) can be an effective and easy-to-use solution for costly barriers to treating illness, such as non-adherence to medications, a problem estimated to have a $300 billion impact on the U.S. health care system. Under the affiliation agreement, Walgreens will feature ResCare HomeCare education materials with its DailyMed by Walgreens(TM) products. ResCare HomeCare employees will discuss DailyMed with their clients as part of a range of services the company offers to help people live more independently.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report December,2012 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Jan 04, 2013
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report December, 2012 sales/trading statement results on Jan 04, 2013

Key Development Headline: CVS Plans to Build a Store on the Lake Forest Plaza Site
Key Development Situation: CVS is planning to build a store on the Lake Forest Plaza site, which contains about 3.5-million square feet of mostly-vacant land in an eastern New Orleans commercial district.

Key Development Headline: Hanger, Inc. Announces Executive Appointments
Key Development Situation: Effective December 11, 2012, Thomas C. Hofmeister, the Vice President-Finance and Chief Accounting Officer of Hanger, Inc., has accepted a new position as Vice President Finance.  In his new role Mr. Hofmeister will be responsible for and oversee two key projects; certain finance and accounting aspects of company’s development and implementation of a comprehensive electronic practice management system, and the establishment of an internal purchasing portal between the company’s SPS distribution business and its Hanger Clinic business. George E. McHenry, the company’s Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer since 2001, has assumed the role of the company’s principal accounting officer.

Key Development Headline: CVS To Review Bolt-On Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation is seeking acquisitions. Larry Merlo, Chief Executive of CVS declined to comment on whether CVS's strategy would include any acquisitions though bolt-on acquisitions to support its retail or PBM units are always being reviewed.

Key Development Headline: California Judge Orders Walgreens to Pay $16.57 Million
Key Development Situation: A California judge has ordered Walgreen Co. to pay $16.57 million to settle a lawsuit claiming more than 600 of its stores in the state illegally dumped hazardous waste. The settlement from a lawsuit filed in June by district attorneys around the state. The legal action followed inspections of trash bins at Walgreens stores. It accused the stores of illegally handling and disposing pesticides, bleach, paint, pharmaceutical waste and other items. The stores were also accused of unlawfully disposing of customer records containing confidential medical information.

Key Development Headline: HCA Seeks Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. is seeking acquisitions. “We also look at acquisition opportunities. There are a lot of the acquisition opportunities in the marketplace today. We continue to be prudent as we evaluate those opportunities. But we anticipate that pipeline of acquisitions should continue to grow over time as we continue to see some pressures in the marketplace on Medicare and Medicaid as well, as increased spend associated with Electronic Health Record and some of the other things that are taking place,” Mark Kimbrough, Vice President of Investor Relations, said.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report November,2012 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Dec 05, 2012
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report November, 2012 sales/trading statement results on Dec 05, 2012

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Opens New Walgreens Flagship Store in the Bucktown-Wicker Park Neighborhood
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. celebrated the grand opening of a new Walgreens flagship store in the Bucktown-Wicker Park neighborhood on Dec. 04, 2012, afternoon, taking the opportunity to remind Chicagoans about the importance of getting a flu shot this season.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Debuts Los Angeles Store at the Corner of Sunset and Vine
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. will welcome the public to the official opening of its 8,000th store nationwide and its first store on the West Coast, located in Los Angeles at the iconic corner of Sunset and Vine. The store, which opens to the public at 10 a.m. on December 1, features an extensive collection of innovative offerings, products and services unexpected from a drugstore. The store will be open 24 hours every day with pharmacy hours from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Promotes D. Melody Trimble to President of the Company's Southern and Western Group
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. announced it has promoted D. Melody Trimble to president of the company's Southern and Western Group, which includes 26 hospitals in seven states. The promotion is effective January 1, 2013. In her new role, Trimble will report to Gary D. Newsome, President and CEO of Health Management. Trimble will replace Joe D. Pinion, who recently announced his retirement from the company effective at the end of the year. Pinion has agreed to be a consultant to Health Management for a transitional period.

Key Development Headline: LHC Group, Inc. Elects Christopher S. Shackelton to its Board of Directors
Key Development Situation: LHC Group, Inc. has elected Christopher S. Shackelton to its board of directors. Shackelton will serve on the audit and corporate development committees of LHC Group's board. Shackelton is co-founder and managing partner of Coliseum Capital Management, LLC, in Stamford, Conn. Coliseum is a private investment company that invests with a long-term orientation in undervalued companies. Coliseum focuses its capital and effort behind strong management teams and boards, demonstrating a willingness to work alongside companies to facilitate further value creation. Shackelton previously served as an analyst with both Watershed Asset Management, LLC, and Morgan Stanley & Co.

Key Development Headline: John Harris to Join Universal Health Services Inc.'s Southern California Group as Vice President
Key Development Situation: John Harris, who previously worked at Sierra Providence Health Network of El Paso, Texas, will be Southern California Group Vice President for Universal Health Services Inc. Harris will be responsible for Inland Valley Medical Center in Wildomar, Rancho Springs Medical Center in Murrieta, Corona Regional Medical Center and Palmdale Regional Medical Center. He also will oversee Temecula's first hospital, Temecula Valley Medical Center, now under construction. The Temecula hospital is scheduled to open in summer 2013.

Key Development Headline: LHC Mulls Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: LHC Group, Inc. is seeking acquisitions. Keith Myers, Chief Executive Officer of LHC, said, "With regard to multiples, it's hard to use an EBITDA multiple as you can imagine, with so many moving parts and reimbursement. We prefer to apply our model and to a volume base, and our comfort level is somewhere around 50% of trailing revenue right now, and even then we're looking for acquisitions that have upside potential."

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Introduces the Ology Brand of Healthy Home Products
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced the launch of ‘Ology(TM)’ the nationally accessible and affordable brand formulated to be free of harmful chemicals. Exclusive to Walgreens family of companies, the Ology brand features a line of baby and personal care products, as well as household cleaners and is the solution to the growing consumer demand for products free of harmful formulations. Ology brand features a line of baby and personal care products, as well as household cleaners. Select Ology brand products are available at Walgreens and Duane Reade locations, as well as online. Items will be available nationwide by early November and are value priced compared to conventional formulas of brands. Ology liquid products are free of harmful chemicals and include: Baby Care -- lotion and 2-in-1 body wash; Laundry -- liquid detergent and fabric softener; Cleaners -- glass cleaner and all-purpose cleaner; and Personal Care -- adult shampoo and conditioner. Ology brand products also include light bulbs and paper products that are 100% tree-free and made from readily renewable resources.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report October,2012 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Nov 05, 2012
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report October, 2012 sales/trading statement results on Nov 05, 2012

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Appoints Ann Walker-Jenkins as Director of Federal Government Affairs
Key Development Situation: Ann Walker-Jenkins has been hired as director of federal government affairs at CVS Caremark Corporation. She was associate director of federal government affairs at the American Association of Nurse Anesthetists. She also served as assistant director of federal affairs for the American Academy of Physician Assistants.

Key Development Headline: Hanger Mulls Additional Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: Hanger, Inc. will look for further acquisitions. Vinit K. Asar, President and Chief Executive Officer of Hanger, said, "Our pipeline of transactions remains healthy and it is still possible for one or more additional acquisitions to close before year end."

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Mulls Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: Amedisys Inc. announced $225 million unsecured credit facility. The five-year revolving credit facility will support the capital needs of Amedisys which include acquisition opportunities.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Promotes Pamela Rudisill to Chief Nursing Executive
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. created a chief nursing executive position and promoted Pamela Rudisill to serve in the role. Rudisill has worked at the hospital chain since 1996, most recently as VP of nursing and patient safety for the past four years. She will continue to hold many of those responsibilities, including overseeing the company's Nursing Leadership Group, Patient Safety Committee and Chief Nursing Executive Council. Rudisill previously served as chief nursing executive of Lake Norman Regional Medical Center, Mooresville, N.C., an HMA facility, from 1996 to 2007.

Key Development Headline: HCA Holdings, Inc.'s Tristar Centennial Medical Center Names Heather Rohan as Nashville Hospital CEO
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc.'s TriStar Centennial Medical Center named Heather Rohan to assume leadership of the Nashville hospital as CEO, effective December 1. For the past seven years, Rohan has been CEO of the for-profit hospital chain's Aventura (Fla.) Hospital and Medical Center. At TriStar, HCA's hospital, Rohan will replace Thomas Herron, who announced in August that he would retire at the end of the year after six years in the position.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Appoints Alan Lotvin as Executive Vice President of Specialty Pharmacy
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced the appointment of Alan Lotvin, MD to the position of Executive Vice President, Specialty Pharmacy. In this role, Dr. Lotvin will have overall responsibility for the company's Specialty Pharmacy strategy with a focus on identifying opportunities for growth and innovation in this fast-growing segment of the health care industry. Dr. Lotvin has extensive experience in the pharmaceutical benefit management and specialty pharmacy industries. Prior to joining CVS Caremark, Dr. Lotvin was President and Chief Executive Officer of ICORE Healthcare. Previously, he has held roles as President and Chief Operating Officer of M|C Communications.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Reaches Civil Settlement with the United States Department of Justice
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced that it has reached a civil settlement with the U.S. Department of Justice regarding its investigation into certain business practices of a subsidiary of Longs Drug Stores Corporation which began prior to the acquisition of Longs by CVS Caremark in October 2008. Pursuant to the settlement agreement, RxAmerica has expressly denied any liability. The settlement resolves allegations that, in 2007 and 2008, Medicare Part D paid claims related to RxAmerica's submission of inaccurate pricing data to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services ("CMS") for use in estimating prescription drug prices on the CMS website tool, Plan Finder, for certain generic drugs covered by a Medicare Part D Prescription Drug Plan sponsored by RxAmerica. The settlement also resolves all allegations in a related federal qui tam complaint filed by certain of the Part D Plan members. These RxAmerica Plan Finder submissions were previously the subject of the CVS Caremark consent order with the Federal Trade Commission earlier in 2012. CVS Caremark has cooperated fully with the United States Department of Justice in resolving this matter, and RxAmerica worked with CMS on a corrective action plan to address any Plan Finder issues in late 2008 and early 2009. As a result of these efforts, in September 2010, CMS closed the corrective action plan, notifying the company that CMS had monitored the sponsor's Medicare Prescription Drug Plan Finder submission performance closely and that it had consistently submitted accurate pricing data to CMS throughout 2009 and 2010. RxAmerica Medicare Part D plans were last offered in calendar year 2011. The settlement includes a payment of $5.25 million to the Department of Justice, plus costs and other fees. These payments have been fully accrued for and will not affect the company's 2012 earnings results. The investigation commenced in 2009 and has been previously disclosed in the company's SEC filings. The company agreed to settle the matter in order to avoid the burden and expense of continuing litigation.

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Inc. Signs New Agreement with Humana Inc. to Provide Home Health Services
Key Development Situation: Amedisys Inc. announced that it has signed a new agreement with Humana Inc. to provide home health services. Under the new agreement Amedisys will receive payment on a per visit basis. Previously, Amedisys was reimbursed on an episodic basis. While the agreement is national in scope, not all markets served under the former agreement may be served under the new agreement. Revenue earned from Humana has been approximately $65-$70 million on an annualized basis.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Mulls Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. is seeking acquisitions. Bob Farnham, Senior Vice President For Finance of Health Management Associates, said, "We will acquire ambulatory surgery centers, diagnostic centers, clinics, physician practices."

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Announces Launch of Taylor Swift Store
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. will launch the Taylor Swift Store at Walgreens, offering a wide array of products from six time Grammy winner Taylor Swift's branded merchandise line. Walgreens and select Duane Reade locations will provide a comprehensive, in-store selection of Taylor Swift music and merchandise. The Taylor Swift merchandise includes t-shirts, bracelets, backpacks, tour books, posters, journals, notebooks, calendars, and iPhone and iPad accessories among other items.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Opens Three MinuteClinic Locations in the Dayton Area
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation has opened three MinuteClinic locations in the Dayton area, with plans for more locations in the year 2013. Clinics have opened at CVS stores in Beavercreek on North Fairfield Road; Springboro on North Main Street; and Maineville in Warren County on Ohio 48. Additional locations are planned for Dayton and for West Chester Twp. in Butler County.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report September,2012 Sales/Trading Statement Results on Oct 03, 2012
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report September, 2012 sales/trading statement results on Oct 03, 2012

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Reports Consolidated Unaudited Earnings Results for the Fourth Quarter and Full Year Ended August 31, 2012; Announces Opening of 169 New Stores
Key Development Situation:
Walgreen Co. reported consolidated unaudited earnings results for the fourth quarter and full year ended August 31, 2012. For the quarter, the company reported net sales of USD 17,073 million compared to USD 17,967 million a year ago. Operating income was USD 586 million compared to USD 1,266 million a year ago. Earnings before income tax provision was USD 549 million compared to USD 1,251 million a year ago. Net earnings were USD 353 million compared to USD 792 million a year ago. Diluted earnings per common share was USD 0.39 compared to USD 0.87 a year ago. Front-end comparable store sales decreased 1.3% in the fourth quarter, customer traffic in comparable stores decreased 3.2% and basket size increased 1.9%, while total sales in comparable stores decreased 8.7%. The company reports adjusted fourth quarter earnings per diluted share of 63 cents, compared with adjusted earnings per diluted share of 66 cents in year-ago quarter. Adjusted fiscal 2012 fourth quarter net earnings were USD 553 million compared with adjusted net earnings of USD 599 million in the year-ago quarter. The company generated $768 million in cash from operations, up 112% from $362 million a year ago, and continued strong cash flow trends. Free cash flow in the quarter was $320 million. Adjusted operating income was $838 million, down 12.6% from $950 million in the fourth quarter of 2011.

For the year, the company reported net sales of USD 71,633 million compared to USD 72,184 million a year ago. Operating income was USD 3,464 million compared to USD 4,365 million a year ago. Earnings before income tax provision was USD 3,376 million compared to USD 4,294 million a year ago. Net earnings were USD 2,127 million compared to USD 2,714 million a year ago. Diluted earnings per common share were USD 2.42 compared to USD 2.94 a year ago. Net cash provided by operating activities was USD 4,431 million compared to USD 3,643 million a year ago. Additions to property and equipment were USD 1,550 million compared to USD 1,213 million a year ago. Non GAAP supplemental adjusted operating income was USD 4,097 million compared to USD 4,358 million a year ago. Non GAAP supplemental adjusted net earnings were USD 2,565 million compared to USD 2,710 million a year ago. Non GAAP supplemental adjusted diluted net earnings were USD 2.93 compared to USD 2.93 a year ago. The company also delivered record fiscal year operating and free cash flow of USD 4.4 billion and USD 2.9 billion, respectively. Free cash flow was at $2.9 billion and up 19% from the prior year. Adjusted operating income for the year was $4.1 billion compared to $4.4 billion in 2011, down 6%.

The company announced opening of 169 new stores and growing well experience store base of nearly 350 locations.

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Services Inc. Announces Resignation of Ken Rivers as Chief Executive Officer
Key Development Situation:
Universal Health Services Inc. announced that September 21, 2012 will be the last day on the job for Ken Rivers, CEO of Universal Health Services Inc.
Rivers is leaving to become president and CEO of Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center in Los Angeles.

Key Development Headline: HCA Holdings, Inc. Settles Feds' Complaint for $16.5 Million
Key Development Situation: The Justice Department and HCA Holdings, Inc. have reached a $16.5 million settlement over violations of federal laws that restrict financial relationships between hospitals and physicians.
