Key Development Headline: Amedisys Inc. Reports Unaudited Consolidated Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2011; Reports Impairment Charges for the Third Quarter Ended September 30, 2011; Revises Earnings Guidance for the Year 2011; Provides Earnings Guidance for the Fourth Quarter of 2011; Announces Executive Changes
Key Development Situation:
Amedisys Inc. reported unaudited consolidated earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2011. For the quarter, the company reported net service revenue of $374,861,000 against $404,680,000 a year ago. Comparing third quarter results to the prior year, the company saw a decline in revenue of approximately $30 million, primarily as a result of the 2011 CMS rate cut of 5.2%, lower Home Health volumes, a reduction in the therapy needs of its patients and continued difficulties with the new therapy regulations. Operating loss was $557,317,000 against operating income of $37,085,000 a year ago. Loss before income taxes was $559,337,000 against income before income taxes of $35,751,000 a year ago. Net loss attributable to the company was $423,722,000 or $14.73 per basic and diluted share against net income attributable to the company of $21,634,000 or $0.76 per diluted share a year ago. Net cash provided by operating activities was $27,780,000 against $47,174,000 a year ago. LBITDA was $547,367,000 against EBITDA of $46,489,000 a year ago. Adjusted EBITDA was $29,446,000 against $51,895,000 a year ago. Adjusted net service revenue was $374,861,000 against $401,004,000 a year ago. Adjusted net income attributable to the company was $10,553,000 or $0.36 per diluted share against $25,465,000 or $0.89 per diluted share a year ago.

For the quarter, the company reported goodwill and other intangibles impairment charge of $574,114,000.

For the nine months, the company reported net service revenue of $1,112,885,000 against $1,239,996,000 a year ago. Operating loss was $491,826,000 against operating income of $155,096,000 a year ago. Loss before income taxes was $498,120,000 against income before income taxes of $149,157,000 a year ago. Net loss attributable to the company was $386,778,000 or $13.53 per basic and diluted share against net income attributable to the company of $90,482,000 or $3.18 per diluted share a year ago. Net cash provided by operating activities was $104,293,000 against $172,608,000 a year ago. LBITDA was $462,861,000 against EBITDA of $180,596,000 a year ago. Adjusted EBITDA was $114,763,000 against $187,203,000 a year ago. Adjusted net service revenue was $1,108,152,000 against $1,232,733,000 a year ago. Adjusted net income attributable to the company was $47,988,000 or $1.65 per diluted share against $95,045,000 or $3.34 per diluted share a year ago.

For the fourth quarter 2011, the company estimates effective tax rate to be 40.5%. The company anticipates the reduction in non-billable therapy visits to continue into the fourth quarter 2011, thereby reducing the impact to revenue as it close out 2011.

For the year 2011, the company’s net service revenue is anticipated to be in the range of $1.475 billion to $1.500 billion. Diluted earnings per share are expected to be in the range of $1.90 to $2.00 based on an estimated 29.3 million shares outstanding. This adjusted guidance excludes the effects of the non-cash impairment charge, any future acquisitions, if any are made, effects of any share repurchase, and non-recurring costs that may be incurred during the year or the impact of the final 2012 Medicare rate changes.

The company announced certain executive leadership changes and a strategic realignment of operating units to better address performance and position the company for long term success. Based on disappointing operating performance and looming 2012 cuts in Medicare reimbursement, the company reviewed portfolio of care centers for long term potential. This review has resulted in the identification of approximately 50 care centers targeted for closure, consolidation, or sale. The company is reorganizing divisional leadership to adjust to these portfolio changes and better align its operations for the future. As part of this reorganization, Mike D. Snow, the company's Chief Operating Officer, is departing to pursue other opportunities. The responsibilities for the company's operations formerly overseen by Mr. Snow will be assumed by William F. Borne, the company's Chief Executive Officer. Jim Robinson, the company's Executive Vice President of Operations, is leading both the home health and hospice business units and will now report directly to William F. Borne, Chief Executive Officer. The company announced that Ronald A. LaBorde has been appointed President. Mr. LaBorde has served on the company's board since 1997, serving as Lead Director since 2003. He will remain a member of the Board of Directors following his employment, at which time Donald Washburn will serve as the company's new Lead Director. In addition, the company announced that effective January 1, 2012, Dale Redman, current Chief Financial Officer, will transition to the role of Executive Vice President and Treasurer in anticipation of his planned retirement during the first quarter of 2012. Following this transition, it is intended that Mr. LaBorde will assume the additional role of Chief Financial Officer.

Key Development Headline: Robbins Geller Rudman & Dowd LLP Files Class Action Suit Against HCA Holdings, Inc
Key Development Situation: Robbins Geller Rudman & Dowd LLP announced that a class action has been commenced in the United States District Court for the Middle District of Tennessee on behalf of purchasers of HCA Holdings, Inc. common stock pursuant or traceable to the Company's Registration Statement and Prospectus issued in connection with its March 9, 2011 initial public offering. The complaint alleges that on or about March 11, 2011, HCA filed its prospectus for the IPO, which forms part of the Registration Statement and which became effective on March 9, 2011. At least 145.1 million shares of HCA common stock were sold to the public at $30 per share, raising $4.4 billion in gross proceeds for the Company and the selling shareholders. On July 25, 2011, the company issued a press release announcing disappointing second quarter 2011 financial results. On this news, the company's stock declined $6.64 per share to close at $27.97 per share on July 25, 2011, a one-day decline of nearly 20%. Then, on October 1, 2011, Barron's issued an article entitled "Where Did the $15.8 Billion Go?", which questioned HCA's accounting practices. According to the article, HCA improperly accounted for two major acquisitions as recapitalizations. In both instances, HCA should have accounted for the transaction as an acquisition using the purchase accounting method, but instead opted to use what is the functional equivalent of a pooling-of-interests method, which method was eliminated by the Financial Accounting Standards Board in 2001 in order to improve the quality of information provided to investors and users of financial statements. By using this prohibited method, HCA overstated its reported earnings, as the Company was able to avoid taking significant charges, including substantial depreciation and amortization charges, which would have negatively impacted its earnings. On this news, HCA's stock declined $1.35 per share to close at $18.81 per share on October 3, 2011, a one-day decline of nearly 7% and a nearly 38% decline from the stock's IPO price. According to the complaint, the true facts which were omitted from the Registration Statement were as follows: the Company improperly accounted for its prior business combinations in violation of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, causing its financial results to be materially misstated; the company failed to maintain effective internal controls concerning its accounting for business combinations; and the company failed to disclose known trends and uncertainties as required by SEC regulations concerning its revenue growth rate. Plaintiff seeks to recover damages on behalf of all purchasers of HCA common stock issued in connection with its March 9, 2011 IPO. The plaintiff is represented by Robbins Geller, which has expertise in prosecuting investor class actions and extensive experience in actions involving financial fraud.

Income from operations was $31,242,000 compared to $18,315,000 for the same period in 2010. Net income was $15,412,000 or $0.45 per diluted share compared to $6,924,000 or $0.21 per basic and diluted share for the same period in 2010. Adjusted income from operations was $31,675,000 compared to $26,854,000 for the same period in 2010. Adjusted net income was $15,681,000 or $0.46 per diluted share compared to $12,090,000 or $0.37 per diluted share for the same period in 2010. Cash flow provided by operations was $24,512,000 compared to $32,218,000 for the same period in 2010. Capital expenditures were $6,485,000 compared to $7,051,000 for the same period in 2010.

The company expects fourth quarter of 2011 revenues between $243 million and $247 million and adjusted diluted EPS between $0.49 and $0.52 

For the full year 2011, the company expects revenues between $914 million and $918 million and adjusted diluted EPS of $1.59 to $1.62. The company's goal is to increase operating margins for the full year by 20 to 40 basis points in its core business. The company anticipates generating cash flow from operations of $70 million to $75 million in 2011.

To invest a total of $30 million to $35 million in new capital additions in 2011 to fund its core businesses, including the development of a comprehensive electronic practice management system during the year 2011.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Announces Executive Changes
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced the promotion of three senior executives within its retail pharmacy organization. Judith Strauss Sansone has been named Senior Vice President of Merchandising for CVS/pharmacy. Most recently, Judith served as Vice President Merchandising and Pricing, responsible for general merchandise, consumables and front store pricing. During her career with CVS/pharmacy, she has served several roles including Vice President Healthcare Merchandising and Vice President Retail Innovation and Store Design. Robert Price, Chief Marketing Officer of CVS/pharmacy, takes on an expanded role in the company with the addition of retail innovation and store design to his responsibilities. Price will more tightly integrate the store and digital environments to create a more personalized experience for shoppers and patients. Scott Baker, RPh, Executive Vice President, Internal Operations, Real Estate and Supply Chain, adds inventory management and logistics to his responsibilities. In his expanded role, Baker will provide senior level support for inventory management and product flow in partnership with the merchandising and pharmacy teams.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Releases Caremark.com Droid Application
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced the release of the Caremark.com Droid application. The application is available at no cost at the Android Market. It provides Android users with the ability to access the Drug Information Database to learn more about various prescription drugs and allows CVS Caremark plan members to log-in and securely manage their prescriptions on-line. The application can be used with Android 2.1 OS and above phones. Any Android user can download the application and use the Drug Information function. This function will connect users to the Drug Information Database where they can research particular prescription medications, get information about how to take them, learn about available generic drug alternatives, see an image of the drug, learn about side effects and precautions, and much more. CVS Caremark PBM members can use the application to register on Caremark.com or log-in securely to their existing Caremark.com accounts from their Androids. Once they are logged in, members can perform a variety of functions, including: Refill a Prescription; Check Prescription Order Status; View Prescription History; Easy Mail Service Prescription Refills; Online New Prescription Requests; Check Drug Coverage and Cost; Locate a Network Pharmacy.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Unveils First Electric Vehicle Charging Station in Orlando
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. will unveil its first electric vehicle (EV) charging station in Orlando at its International Drive and Sand Lake Road location with a ribbon cutting at 10 a.m. Eastern time, as City of Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer makes the inaugural charge. The drugstore chain is working with Car Charging Group, an owner and provider of EV charging stations, to offer convenient and accessible charging sites at eight locations throughout the area by the end of October. The charging stations will feature two level 2 chargers that are compatible with every EV produced in North America.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Announces Executive Appointments
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced two additions to the leadership team of its pharmacy, health and wellness division. Dr. Jeffrey Kang will join the company on Oct. 31 as senior vice president of health and wellness services and solutions, reporting to both President and CEO Greg Wasson and President of Pharmacy, Health and Wellness Kermit Crawford. In addition, Mike Ellis has joined Walgreens as vice president of specialty pharmacy and infusion, reporting to Crawford. Most recently Kang was chief medical officer at CIGNA, where he was responsible for health strategy and policy for its medical, pharmacy and behavioral products. Kang also was responsible for CIGNA's pay for performance programs, including its patient centered medical home and accountable care organizations. Prior to his position at CIGNA, he served as chief clinical officer at the Health Care Financing Administration (now Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services) from 1998 to 2002. He also was chief medical officer for the Office of Managed Care from 1995 to 1998. Kang began his career as the executive director of the Urban Medical Group. Most recently Ellis managed private investments for companies in healthcare and other industries. Prior to that, he served as the senior vice president of specialty trade relations and contracting and pharmaceutical services for CVS Caremark. His more than 28 years of experience covers both the specialty pharmacy and infusion services industries, including senior positions with companies including AdvancePCS, Olsten Health Services and Quantum Health Resources.

Key Development Headline: HCI Introduces New Infection Control Series Televisions for Healthcare Facilities
Key Development Situation: HCI has announced the release of their new 26" and 32" Infection Control Series (ICS) RoomMate Digital Televisions for use in hospitals and other healthcare facilities to entertain and educate patients, visitors, and staff. The hospital grade televisions feature new technology that can reduce the risk of infection from the spread of bacteria. The ICS televisions, part of HCI's RoomMate family of hospital-grade TVs, offer a design made exclusively for the healthcare industry with patients in mind. Included on each unit is an all-glass, unbreakable front that is impervious to bacteria and can be wiped down with hospital-grade disinfectants. The whispering wall speakers eliminate bacteria-filled speaker grills commonly found on current hospital models, and the capacitive touch button panel accommodates weak fingers and never wears out. The ICS series also includes virtual channel lineup, media player, USB clone and "Clean TV" button for use during TV cleaning.

Key Development Headline: MMM & PMC Maintain Walgreens Pharmacies in Pharmacy Network
Key Development Situation: MMM Healthcare Inc. & PMC Medicare Choice Inc. and Walgreen Co. have announced that MMM & PMC members will continue to have access to the Walgreens pharmacy network. Express Scripts Inc. and Walgreen Co. were able to reach an agreement so that the MMM and PMC members can continue accessing Walgreens pharmacies. This contract will enable Walgreens to continue providing convenient, accessible pharmacy services to the thousands of MMM and PMC members in Puerto Rico after December 31, 2011 and is evidence of the commitment Walgreens has in working with partners to continue serving patients and customers.

Key Development Headline: LHC Group, Inc. Enters into Settlement Agreement for Resolve of Pending Inquiry of the Civil Division of the United States Department of Justice and the United States Attorney's Office for the Western District of Louisiana
Key Development Situation: LHC Group, Inc. has entered into a settlement agreement, which will resolve the pending inquiry of the Civil Division of the United States Department of Justice and the United States Attorneys' Office for the Western District of Louisiana. The Settlement agreement is related to a qui tam complaint filed by a relator against LHC under the whistleblower provisions of the False Claims Act, 31 U.S.C. sections 3729-3733. The settlement agreement is with (a) the United States, including signatories from the Civil Division, the Office of Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services, the Office of Personnel Management and the civil division of the USAO Louisiana and (b) the relator. Pursuant to the Settlement Agreement, LHC will pay the United States $65 million in a single lump sum payment to be paid within seven days following the effective date of the settlement agreement. In exchange for the payment of the Settlement Amount, the United States and the relator agree to release LHC from any civil or administrative monetary claim under the False Claims Act and certain other legal theories for certain covered conduct. The released covered conduct, which is more fully described in the Settlement Agreement, includes claims involving home health services rendered by LHC from 2006 to 2008 with regard to whether such home health services were either not medically necessary or were delivered to patients who were not homebound. In consideration of the obligations in the settlement agreement and the corporate integrity agreement OIG-HHS also agrees to release and refrain from instituting, directing or maintaining any administrative action seeking to exclude LHC from Medicare, Medicaid and other federal health care programs with respect to the covered conduct.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Puts Properties Up For Sale
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. is putting eight properties up for sale. Seven of them are intended to house retail stores. The auctions are scheduled to take place from November 11, 2011 to November 17, 2011 and will be managed by Inland Real Estate Brokerage & Auctions Inc. These seven properties are located in the Twentynine Palms, Calif.; Bonita Springs, Fla.; Port Charlotte, Fla.; Yulee, Fla.; St. Augustine, Fla.; Milton, Ga.; and Pooler, Ga. Drakeshire Shopping Center is also up for sale. "These properties are all quality sites in excellent locations, boasting high visibility on signalized corners. All sites were previously vetted and approved through Walgreen's internal assessments as prime locations for Walgreens stores, further evidence they are ideal for a wide array of retail applications," Ira Becker, senior consultant with Inland Real Estate, said.

Key Development Headline: LHC Group Violates Federal Law by Discriminating Against a Field Nurse Because of Disability
Key Development Situation: LHC Group violated federal law by discriminating against a field nurse because of her disability, the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) charged in a lawsuit. The EEOC alleged that LHC Group, doing business as Gulf Coast Homecare in Picayune, Miss., denied Kristy M. Sones a reasonable accommodation and then fired her because of her epilepsy. The EEOC alleged that Sones informed Gulf Coast Branch Manager Jennifer Taggard that she had a history of one seizure prior to being hired as a field nurse in 2006. Sones had annual physicals during her employment, disclosed her epilepsy and the medications she was taking to her employer. After performing successfully as a field nurse, Sones was promoted to a team leader position in March 2009.

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Seeks Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: Amedisys Inc. is looking for acquisition opportunities. Amedisys would look for acquisitions targeting about 53% of the healthcare agencies that are going to lose money because of the cuts. Amedisys' Chief Executive Officer, William Borne said he can comfortably spend $330 million of capital next year for acquisitions, and remains hopeful that, despite the cuts, next year will see a long-delayed industry consolidation.

Key Development Headline: HCA Holdings, Inc. Announces Executive Changes
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. announced that two veteran HCA division presidents are undertaking new responsibilities. Stephen E. Corbeil, who has been President of the company's Midwest Division in Kansas City since 2007, will become President of HCA's Nashville-based TriStar Division. He replaces Larry Kloess, whose retirement was announced earlier this month. In addition, HCA veteran and longtime Delta Division President Mel Lagarde will become President of HCA's newly-named MidAmerica Division. This division includes the company's existing Delta Division (based in New Orleans) and Midwest Division operations. HCA will maintain a market presence in the New Orleans area with certain division staff based there. These transitions will begin immediately. As MidAmerica Division President, Lagarde, 54, is responsible for HCA's 18 hospitals and six ambulatory surgery centers in Missouri, Kansas, Louisiana and Mississippi. In his new role leading TriStar, Corbeil, 51, is responsible for the division's 17 hospitals and nine surgery centers in Tennessee, Georgia and Kentucky, including seven facilities in HCA's hometown market of Middle Tennessee.

Key Development Headline: Woman Claims Walgreen Co.'s Pharmacy Supplied Wrong Prescription
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. has filed a notice to remove a lawsuit against it to the U.S. District Court for the Middle District of Alabama. The lawsuit was filed by a patient who alleges she was given the wrong prescription by a Walgreen pharmacist in February 2010. Readie Bailey claims that her doctor prescribed five-milligram tablets of prednisone, instructing her to take half of a tablet each day. Instead, the lawsuit claims she was given a prescription containing 50-milligram tablets. The lawsuit seeks unspecified damages. However, Walgreen alleges that the amount in controversy exceeds $75,000 and seeks removal to federal court.

Key Development Headline: Hanger Orthopedic Group Inc. Appoints Kenneth W. Wilson as President and Chief Operating Officer of Distribution Business Unit, SPS
Key Development Situation: Hanger Orthopedic Group Inc. announced it has named Kenneth W. Wilson as President and Chief Operating Officer of its orthotic and prosthetic distribution business unit, Southern Prosthetic Supply, effective immediately. Mr. Wilson brings more than 20 years experience at Cardinal Health, specializing in the delivery of medical/surgical and pharmaceutical products to physician offices, ambulatory surgery centers, clinical laboratories, and other sites of outpatient care, most recently as Cardinal Health's Senior Vice President /General Manager. As President and COO of SPS, Mr. Wilson will lead the operations and strategic direction of Hanger's distribution business, reporting to Mr. Asar. Maintaining an inventory of approximately 26,000 individual products, SPS is the nation's largest dedicated orthotics and prosthetics distributor, as well as the leading manufacturer and distributor of therapeutic footwear for diabetic patients in the podiatric market. As previously announced, current SPS President and COO Ron May will retire after 33 years with SPS on November 7.

Key Development Headline: Express Scripts Inc. Sues Walgreen Co. in Contract Dispute
Key Development Situation: Express Scripts Inc. announced that it is suing Walgreen Co., arguing the drugstore chain is trying to lure away its customers. The lawsuit alleges that Walgreen Co. is telling Express Scripts plan members, and especially Medicare Part D beneficiaries, that they will not be able to fill their prescriptions at Walgreen pharmacies unless they leave Express Scripts and switch to a new pharmacy benefits management plan. Express Scripts said this violates the contract between the two companies. In the lawsuit, Express Scripts said Walgreen Co. is trying to get Express Scripts members to switch to new plans so it can keep their business and continue being paid to fill their prescriptions. Express Scripts Inc. asked a court stop Walgreen from encouraging members to switch plans, saying it would hurt its business.

Key Development Headline: Michael Cuffe to Become President and Chief Executive Officer of Physician Services for HCA Holdings, Inc., Effective October 26, 2011
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. announced Dr. Michael Cuffe will become President and Chief Executive Officer of Physician Services for HCA, effective October 26. This is a new role created as part of an internal reorganization the company announced in February. Cuffe, who currently serves as Vice President for Ambulatory Services and Chief Medical Officer of Duke University Health System, will report to Dr. Jonathan B. Perlin, President of HCA's Clinical and Physician Services Group and Chief Medical Officer. The company's Physician Services organization provides comprehensive practice management in support of HCA's overall clinical operations. Prior to his current position with Duke, Cuffe served as Vice President of Medical Affairs at the Duke University Health System from 2005 to 2011. Before that, Cuffe served as Vice Chair of Medical Affairs for the Department of Medicine as well as in various leadership roles in the Duke Clinical Research Institute. Cuffe also served as Vice Dean for Medical Affairs of the Duke University School of Medicine from 2008 to 2011.

Key Development Headline: Hanger Orthopedic Group Inc. Appoints Vinit K. Asar to President and Chief Operating Officer
Key Development Situation: Hanger Orthopedic Group Inc. announced the appointment of Vinit K. Asar to President and Chief Operating Officer, effective immediately. Mr. Asar joined the company in December 2008 as Executive Vice President and Chief Growth Officer with nearly 20 years of global business operations experience in the medical device sector at Johnson & Johnson. In his new position, Mr. Asar will continue to lead Hanger's emerging businesses and growth opportunities, while taking on additional responsibility for Hanger's SPS and Linkia business units in distribution and network management, respectively. Over the past two years, Mr. Asar led the identification, development, and execution of new opportunities for Hanger's existing operations and launched new business initiatives consistent with the company's overall growth strategy.

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Inc. Names James T. Robinson as Executive Vice President of Home Health Care
Key Development Situation: Amedisys Inc. announced that Executive Vice President of Hospice James (Jim) T. Robinson will also serve as Executive Vice President of Home Health Care for the company. In his role as Executive Vice President of Home Care, Mr. Robinson will be responsible for the growth and overall performance of the company's home health care business unit. Prior to joining company as the Executive Vice President of Hospice in 2010, Mr. Robinson was the Senior Vice President for American Care Source Holdings, an ancillary healthcare management company.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report August,2011  Sales/Trading Statement Results on Sep 06, 2011
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report August, 2011  sales/trading statement results on Sep 06, 2011

Key Development Headline: HCA Holdings, Inc. Announces Retirement of Lawrence H. Kloess III as President of Tristar Division, Effective December 31, 2011
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. announced that Lawrence H. Kloess III, president of the company's TriStar Division, will retire effective December 31, 2011.

Key Development Headline: HCA Holdings, Inc. Appoints Dr. Ravi Chari as Vice President of Clinical Excellence
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. announced Dr. Ravi Chari has been named Vice President of Clinical Excellence, a new position, effective September 1, 2011. Chari had previously served as Chief Medical Officer of HCA's TriStar Division. In his new role, he is responsible for enhancing physician engagement and reducing unnecessary clinical variation in the company's ongoing efforts to improve quality. Chari, who reports to Dr. Jonathan B. Perlin, President of HCA's Clinical and Physician Services Group and Chief Medical Officer, has worked with physicians to identify opportunities to standardize evidence-based practices that reduced length of stay, for example, and resulted in better patient outcomes.

Key Development Headline: LHC Group, Inc. Announces Executive Changes
Key Development Situation: LHC Group, Inc. announced that proven healthcare development executive Don Adam has joined the Company as senior vice president and chief development officer for home health and hospice services. Adam's credentials include more than a decade of post-acute healthcare experience at St. Louis-based RehabCare Group Inc., where he served as chief development officer and senior vice president of mergers and acquisitions. Before joining RehabCare, he spent ten years in the banking industry. The Company also announced the retirement of John L. Indest. Indest has served as special adviser to the chief executive officer since August 2009.

Key Development Headline: Pharmacist Jeremy Hoven Sues Walgreens
Key Development Situation: After he foiled a store robbery with a gun he pulled out of his pocket, Benton Harbor pharmacist Jeremy Hoven said he was fired from his job at Walgreens. Now, he's fighting back with a federal lawsuit against Walgreens, alleging wrongful termination. He filed the lawsuit in U.S. District Court in Grand Rapids this week, the latest development in a case that has made headlines across the country and angered many, particularly those who support gun rights. Hoven said he had a right to act in self-defense and in defense of others. According to his lawsuit, he was working around 4:30 a.m. on May 8 when two masked gunmen entered the store on Benton Harbor's Napier Avenue. He started to call 911 when a gunman jumped the counter and pointed a handgun at him. Hoven observed the gunman's finger jerking on the gun's trigger as it was pointed at him and he (Hoven) immediately backed up and drew his concealed handgun. "At that moment, Hoven reasonably and justifiably believed that he was going to be shot and either killed or seriously injured by the armed robber. Hoven then fired his handgun several times in self-defense and in defense of his co-workers. The robbers fled. One left a handgun behind. No workers or customers were hurt. Five days later, the lawsuit said, Hoven was told he could resign or be fired. Hoven was licensed to carry a firearm, having obtained a concealed-pistol license in 2008. Hoven, who is 36, began working full-time for Walgreens in 2006. He was working at the Napier Avenue store on December 5, 2007, when the store was robbed at gunpoint. Several customers fled to the back of the store, where the pharmacy is located, to escape the robbers. After the holdup, Hoven asked that a panic-button device be installed, and that the store close during power outages. Walgreens did not act on the requests. He then obtained the license to carry a concealed weapon and bought a Smith & Wesson handgun he kept in his pants pocket.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Appoints Mark S. Cosby as President of CVS/pharmacy
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced that Mark S. Cosby has been named President of CVS/pharmacy effective October 1, 2011. Cosby, 52, most recently served as Macy's president of stores where he was responsible for all Macy's store operations and support functions nationwide. Cosby succeeds Merlo who led the company's retail business prior to taking over as CEO of CVS Caremark in March of this year. As President, Cosby will have responsibility for all aspects of the company's Retail business including its more than 7,200 retail stores, 19 distribution centers and award-winning e-commerce site as well as retail merchandising, supply chain, marketing, real estate, front store and pharmacy operations.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Appoints Thomas J. Sabatino, Jr. as Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary, Effective September 12. 2011
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. appointed Thomas J. Sabatino, Jr., as executive vice president, general counsel and corporate secretary, effective Sept. 12. 2011. Sabatino replaces Dana Green, executive vice president, general counsel and corporate secretary, who is retiring after 37 years with the company. Sabatino, 52, joins Walgreens having held general counsel roles with United Airlines Inc., Schering-Plough Corporation, Baxter International Inc., and American Medical International Inc.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens Settles Medicaid Fraud Case for $140,000
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. has agreed to pay $140,000 to resolve allegations that it overbilled the federal Medicaid program as well as Connecticut's ConnPACE Program for prescription drugs. According to the investigation by the Department of Social Services' pharmacy services unit, Walgreens incorrectly handled billing in cases where patients were eligible under both plans. The company billed both programs, resulting in excess payments. The alleged fraudulent billing occurred between June 1, 2006, and Aug. 31, 2008. Under the settlement, Walgreens will pay $140,000 to be shared among the two programs.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Launches Nice!(TM) Store Brand Chainwide
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. officially unveiled its new store brand Nice!(TM) in stores across the country. The new brand will include more than 400 high quality grocery and household products at prices up to 30% below other national brands. Walgreens plans to have most Nice!(TM) product on its shelves by early 2012, including many that go beyond what might be expected from a drugstore brand, such as soups, sauces and bakery items. The company will continue adding products to the Nice!(TM) brand throughout the next few years. Nice!(TM) features a bold, clean design aimed at being easily recognizable and simplifying the shopping experience. Current store brands including Cafe W, Deerfield Farms, W and others will be phased out and transitioned to Nice!(TM). The change is Walgreens latest move in its strategy to build its private brand business, including consolidation of many of the brands in its existing portfolio.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report July,2011  Sales/Trading Statement Results on Aug 03, 2011
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report July, 2011  sales/trading statement results on Aug 03, 2011

Key Development Headline: HCI Introduces New 13.3" Hospital-Grade Low Voltage Swing Arm Bedmate II Television
Key Development Situation: HCI has announced the release of their new 13.3" Hospital-grade Low Voltage Swing Arm BedMate II Television. The TV is designed for use in hospitals, dialysis clinics, infusion centers, and other healthcare facilities to entertain and educate patients. The BedMate is the only model available that features ultra-reliable capacitive touch buttons designed to withstand heavy usage and are sensitive to weak fingers. HCI televisions are made exclusively for the healthcare industry with patients in mind. The 13" BedMate includes a safety halo that allows patients to move the TV freely on the swing arm without harm to the TV or patient. A USB Clone makes setting up numerous televisions in the facility easy and efficient. With an antimicrobial acrylic surface, cleaning is easier and helps protect patients from nosocomial infections. The TV's built-in USB media player enables patients to watch movies, listen to music or view pictures on demand during treatment to enhance the patient experience.

Key Development Headline: LHC Group, Inc. Names Cathy S. Newhouse as Senior Vice President of Clinical Program Development and Innovation
Key Development Situation: LHC Group, Inc. announced that effective August 15, 2011, Cathy S. Newhouse, RN, will join the Company as senior vice president of clinical program development and innovation. Ms. Newhouse, an accomplished registered nurse and healthcare executive with more than 25 years' experience in home health management, will lead clinical program development and innovation initiatives, including oversight for clinical information analytics, care transition, telehealth, telemonitoring, education, training and clinical certifications, for LHC Group's more than 300 locations in 19 states. She will also oversee clinical relations at each of LHC Group's 123 hospital joint venture locations. Ms. Newhouse previously served as senior vice president of sales and clinical programs at Almost Family in Louisville, Kentucky. Prior experience includes more than 20 years in operations and clinical leadership roles at Gentiva Health Services, Melville, N.Y., with terms as vice president of specialties, vice president of orthopedics and vice president of regional sales.

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Inc. Names Todd Roscoe as Vice President of Managed Care
Key Development Situation: Todd Roscoe has been named vice president of managed care at Amedisys Inc. He was chief managed care officer for Healthplace America.

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Services Inc. Provides Earnings Guidance for the Second Half Year of 2011 and Full Year of 2011; Expects to Open 150 New Beds in 2011
Key Development Situation:
Universal Health Services Inc. provided earnings guidance for the second half year of 2011 and full year of 2011. For the second half year, capital spend guidance, the pace of the spend will pick up in the second half of the year get to is much more likely to be kind of a $275 million to $300 million number. But certainly company guidance implies that company earnings will be lower in the second half of the year. 

For the full year, the company expects earnings per diluted share is to be $3.85 to $4. Free cash flow is about using a number of about $400 million. 

The company has expected opening of another 150 new beds during the remainder of the year 2011.

Key Development Headline: HMA Eyes Acquisitions
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. (HMA) announced net income of $48.61 million and revenue of $1.4 billion for the second quarter of 2011. HMA seeks acquisitions. "We continue to believe that over the foreseeable future the acquisition and partnership pipeline represents a tremendous growth opportunity for us. We continue to review partnership opportunities with community hospitals in non-urban and mid size markets, and we will remain disciplined in our acquisition approach," Gary Newsome, HMA President and Chief Executive Officer, said during the earnings report. HMA shares fell 40 cents at $9.3.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Plans to Offer Electric Vehicle Charging Stations at Approximately 800 Locations Across the Country by End of the Year 2011
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. plans to offer electric vehicle (EV) charging stations at approximately 800 locations across the country by the end of the year, making it the nation's largest retail host. The company's neighborhood stores will provide convenient locations for EV drivers to recharge near home or work. The charging stations will feature either a high-speed direct current (DC) charger that can add 30 miles of range in as little as 10 minutes of charging time, or a Level 2 charger that can add up to 25 miles of range per hour of charge.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Commits to Convert or Open at Least 1,000 Food Oasis Stores over the Next Five Years
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that it is committing to convert or open at least 1,000 food oasis stores across the country over the next five years.

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Services Inc. Hires Marvin G. Pember as Senior Vice President and President of Acute Care Division
Key Development Situation: Universal Health Services Inc. announced Marvin G. Pember had been hired as senior vice president of the company and president of its Acute Care Division. Pember had been executive vice president and chief financial officer at Indiana University Health Inc., a nonprofit hospital system.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Pay $2.8 Million Settlement with Massachusetts Attorney General's Office
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. has reached a $2.8 million settlement with the Massachusetts attorney general's office after an investigation showed the company had been overcharging public entities for prescription drugs as part of the worker's compensation system. The attorney general alleges that Walgreens billed and received payment from cities, towns and state agencies for filling prescriptions for workers compensation claims that exceeded the allowable prices under Massachusetts law. Under the agreement, the company will re-pay these charges, and also pay another $1.4 million to the state.

Key Development Headline: Beverly B. Wallace Resigns as President of Parallon Business Solutions of HCA Holdings, Effective December 31, 2011
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. announced that on July 11, 2011, Beverly B. Wallace, President of Parallon Business Solutions of the company announced her retirement effective December 31, 2011. The company will select a successor to her position in due course.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation to Close Kansas City Facility and Lay Off 74 Employees
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation is closing an Aetna facility in Kansas City that fills mail-order prescriptions. The move affects 74 employees. The employees will be laid off this year. The company reported that all employees would leave the location, 10991 N.W. Airworld Drive, by the end of the year. The affected employees - who will include pharmacy technicians, mail clerks and inventory managers - will work with HR to find placement in other positions within the company. Those who are not qualified for other positions will be eligible for transition packages, outplacement support and career counseling.

Key Development Headline: Walgreens Expands its Food Selection in San Francisco's Bayview Neighborhood
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced the expansion of its fresh food selection at the location at 3(rd) Street and Williams Avenue in San Francisco's Bayview community. The drugstore now offers a larger assortment of fresh fruits, vegetables, whole grains, beans, lean protein and other healthy meal components to help address the need for greater access to affordable, nutritious food in this community. The neighborhood, identified as a food desert, has long lacked options for foods necessary to maintain a healthy diet. The store is Walgreens first location in the Bay area to undergo a redesign to accommodate the expanded food selection now termed "Food Oasis." The new layout includes approximately 500 additional square feet of space dedicated to food items, an offering believed to be unprecedented in the city from a traditional retail drugstore. In addition to its Bayview location, Walgreens plans to have its expanded food selection available in food deserts in Oakland and Berkeley by the fall.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report June,2011  Sales/Trading Statement Results on Jul 06, 2011
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report June, 2011  sales/trading statement results on Jul 06, 2011

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Services Inc. Appoints Marvin G. Pember as Senior Vice President and President of Acute Care Division
Key Development Situation: Universal Health Services Inc. announced that Marvin G. Pember will be joining UHS as Senior Vice President of the company, and President of its Acute Care Division. Pember, 57, comes to UHS with more than 28 years of healthcare management experience. For the past 12 years, he has served at Indiana University (IU) Health Inc., where he was Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. IU Health, formerly known as Clarian Health Partners Inc., is a nonprofit hospital system that operates 16 facilities in the state of Indiana.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Plans Expansion in City of Chicago
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. unveiled its 'Chicago Hometown Investment Initiative,' a plan to provide an estimated 600 new jobs in the city over the next two years and quadruple its number of food oasis stores. Roughly half of the jobs are expected to result from expansion of Walgreens downtown office space for E-commerce, information technology and related areas. Approximately 300 other new jobs in the city are planned to be created by new store openings and remodeling of many of Walgreens 142 Chicago drugstores, including the planned expansion of Walgreens 11 food oasis stores in the city to nearly 50 over the next two years. Walgreens 'Chicago Hometown Investment Initiative' includes three key components: Expanded downtown office space: Walgreens plan to expand its downtown presence for E-commerce, information technology and other support areas, some of which have been located in the Sullivan Center since March 2010. Walgreens estimates that the expansion will bring approximately 300 jobs to downtown Chicago. Expansion of food oasis stores: Walgreens intends to quadruple the number of Chicago stores in which it provides expanded healthy food selections to serve communities identified as food deserts, or areas that lack access to basic foods necessary to maintain a healthy diet. In August 2010, Walgreens celebrated the opening of 10 redesigned stores on Chicago's South and West Sides to include more than 750 new food items, including fresh fruits and vegetables, frozen meats and fish, pasta, rice, beans, eggs, whole grain cereals and other healthy meal components. The company now plans to double the number of stores with expanded healthy food selections by 2012, and double the number again in 2013, to reach a total of nearly 50 food oasis stores. New and remodeled drugstores: Walgreens plans to open at least five additional stores in Chicago over the next two years, while also investing in remodeling many of its existing stores in the city. The new and remodeled stores, combined with expansion of Walgreens food oasis locations, are expected to add approximately 300 new jobs in the city.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Introduces New Web Pickup Service Throughout the Chicago Area
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. has combined the convenience of online shopping with its neighborhood stores, introducing its new Web Pickup service at locations throughout the Chicago area. Chicago is the first full market rollout for Web Pickup, which enables consumers to shop online at Walgreens.com and pick up orders at a Walgreens store in as little as an hour. The service is also currently available at 27 stores in San Jose, California. Currently Web Pickup is available at nearly 300 locations in the Chicago metropolitan area. Full market rollout (480 stores) is expected to be complete in August. Most non-prescription items found in-store are available online through the service. By visiting the Web Pickup site (www.walgreens.com/webpickup), shoppers can build a cart of any size and dollar amount for pickup at any participating store in as little as one hour. Payment is provided online and users have the option to receive either a text message or e-mail notification once their order is ready. Orders can be picked up at the photo counter at participating stores. In the coming months, select Chicago area Walgreens will also offer curbside delivery. Stores offering the service will have designated parking spots for Web Pickup customers. A $20 minimum order is required for curbside delivery.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Announces Unsuccessful Contract Renewal Negotiations with Express Scripts
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that contract renewal negotiations with Express Scripts Inc. have been unsuccessful, and as a result the company is planning not to be part of Express Scripts’ pharmacy provider network as of Jan. 1, 2012. Beginning 2012, Express Scripts’ network would no longer include Walgreens 7,700 pharmacies nationwide, including Walgreens more than 250 Duane Reade pharmacies in the New York City area.

Key Development Headline: Universal Health Services, Inc. Announces Resignation Richard J. Santorum from Board of Directors
Key Development Situation: Universal Health Services Inc. announced that former United States Senator Richard J. Santorum has resigned from the company's Board of Directors. Senator Santorum tendered his resignation as result of his recent and formal announcement of his candidacy for President of the United States. The company and Senator Santorum had previously discussed that should he formally initiate a campaign for President, the Senator would thereafter resign from the Board. In light of the formal initiation of his campaign for President, Senator Santorum is unable to provide the time and effort necessary to serve as a member of the Board of Directors. Senator Santorum had been a member of the company's Board of Directors since April 2007.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Appoints Steve Pemberton as Divisional Vice President of Diversity and Inclusion
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. has named Steve Pemberton the company's divisional vice president of diversity and inclusion. In this role, he also becomes the company's first Chief Diversity Officer. Pemberton will report to Kathleen Wilson-Thompson, senior vice president and Chief Human Resources Officer. Pemberton is responsible for ensuring that Walgreens demonstrates cultural and workforce diversity. He takes the lead on directing activities to help serve diverse markets and populations, including customers in medically underserved areas, food deserts and urban areas. In addition, Pemberton will also help strengthen relationships with diverse suppliers and communities. Pemberton spent seven years with Monster.com, where most recently he was Chief Diversity Officer and vice president of diversity and inclusion.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Enhances Hepatitis C Support Program to Help Patients Manage New Triple Therapy Regimen
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced that it is enhancing its hepatitis C patient support program following the recent FDA approval of two new add-on therapies for hepatitis C. While the new therapies offer improved response rates and a shorter treatment regimen for patients, they still result in uncomfortable and challenging side effects. The dedicated Hep C CareTeam educates patients about their disease and treatment regimen and supports them throughout therapy. The Team also researches and manages the benefits verification process, ensures on-time delivery of the medication, coordinates injection training for new patients and communicates proactively with the patient's physician. Hepatitis C is the most common blood borne viral infection in the United States. Current estimates suggest that approximately 3.2 million Americans may be infected with the virus, many of whom are unaware they have the disease because they do not experience any symptoms. Traditional therapies for the disease have low response rates and often have significant side effects (primarily flu-like symptoms) that cause the patient to feel worse during therapy and may contribute to non-adherence. In fact, only about 25% of patients who initiate therapy complete the full treatment regimen. The CVS Caremark Specialty Pharmacy Hep C CareTeam is comprised of nurses, pharmacists and pharmacy service representatives. These professionals are focused on the treatment of hepatitis C and undergo extensive, proprietary training and education related to the disease and available therapies. The Hep C CareTeam reinforces the physician's instructions to make sure the patient safely and effectively administers their prescribed medication and proactively communicates with the physician as needed to address any treatment related issues or complications that may arise.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report May,2011  Sales/Trading Statement Results on Jun 03, 2011
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report May, 2011  sales/trading statement results on Jun 03, 2011

Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Appoints Pascal J. Goldschmidt as M.D. to Board of Directors
Key Development Situation: Health Management Associates Inc. announced the appointment of Pascal J. Goldschmidt, M.D. to its board of directors. This appointment increases the number of board members from nine to ten. Pascal J. Goldschmidt, M.D., an internationally renowned cardiologist and cardiovascular researcher, is senior vice president for medical affairs and dean of the University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine. He also serves as chief executive officer of the University of Miami Health System. Dr. Goldschmidt, whose research applies genomics and cell therapy to the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of coronary artery disease, was previously chairman of the Department of Medicine at Duke University Medical Center. Before taking the chairman's role, he served as chief of Duke's Division of Cardiology. Before joining the Duke faculty in 2000, he was director of cardiology at The Ohio State University College of Medicine and Public Health, where he built the Heart and Lung Research Institute and launched a heart hospital.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Wins Integrated 3-Year Blue Cross and Blue Shield Federal Employee Program Contract
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced that it has been awarded a three-year contract to provide integrated pharmacy benefit services for the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Government-wide Service Benefit Plan, also known as the Federal Employee Program (FEP), based on the best overall value. The company will continue to provide FEP's clinical programs and retail pharmacy benefit management services and also provide mail order pharmacy services and specialty pharmacy services to FEP's more than 5 million federal employees, retirees and dependents. The new agreement, which runs through 2014, brings the relationship between CVS Caremark and FEP to more than 20 years. CVS Caremark will continue to provide retail pharmacy benefit management services, including network contracting and management of a comprehensive suite of highly-customized clinical programs, and also provide mail order and specialty pharmacy services.

Key Development Headline: Hanger Orthopedic Group Inc. Approve the Amendment to its Certificate of Incorporation
Key Development Situation: Hanger Orthopedic Group Inc. announced that at the annual general meeting held on May 12, 2011, the shareholders approved the amendment to the company's Certificate of Incorporation providing for the removal of the class of Non-Voting Common Stock; approved an amendment to the company's Certificate of Incorporation to permit amendments to the Company's By-Laws by the company's Board of Directors; and approve an amendment to the company's Certificate of Incorporation to remove duplicative provisions and make certain other non-substantive changes.

Key Developments by Type: Executive/Board Changes - Other; Changes in Company Bylaws/Rules
Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Elects Mr. David W. Dorman as Chairman of the Board; Announces Amendments to its By-Laws
Key Development Situation:
On May 11, 2011, immediately following the 2011 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, the Board of Directors of CVS Caremark Corporation elected Mr. David W. Dorman as Chairman of the Board. Mr. Dorman, former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of AT&T and a member of the CVS Caremark Board since 2006, was previously determined to be independent pursuant to the company's categorical standards for director independence and the Corporate Governance Rules of the New York Stock Exchange. 

The board amended and restated the company's By-laws to remove a reference to the position of lead director, and also to provide that certain notices to directors may be delivered by e-mail, in addition to other methods of delivery.

Key Development Headline: HCA Holdings, Inc. Officially Launches New Subsidiary
Key Development Situation: HCA Holdings, Inc. officially launched a new subsidiary that will offer healthcare providers a range of businesses services including revenue cycle, staffing management, and supply chain solutions. The company intends Parallon Business Solutions to work "in parallel" with other healthcare providers to improve their performance and delivery of care. One unit of Parallon will provide revenue cycle management, payroll, health information management and physician credentialing. A second unit will focus on strategic healthcare staffing and recruiting solutions to help hospitals increase operational efficiencies and improve employee satisfaction. A third unit will optimize facility inventory to make sure hospitals have the right products at the right time.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Announces Changes Senior Executive Positions
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced that its Board member and former Lead Director Terrence Murray recognized the work done by former Chairman and CEO Thomas M. Ryan who retired effective with the end of the annual meeting, held on May 11, 2011. Following the meeting, the Board was expected to elect a new non-executive Chairman, David Dorman, former Chairman and CEO of AT&T and a CVS Caremark Board member since 2006. Recent additions to the Board include Anne Finucane of Bank of America and Tony White, ex-Chair and CEO of Applied Biosystems.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Agrees to Pay $105,000 to Connecticut
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation has agreed to pay $105,000 to Connecticut and offer discounts to customers who find outdated goods, to settle charges that it sold expired food and over-the-counter drugs. The settlement with Attorney General George Jepsen, comes 17 months after former Attorney General Richard Blumenthal filed suit against the drugstore chain. The outdated products included cough and allergy medicines, baby formula and antacids, energy drinks and milk, and eggs and yogurt, according to the lawsuit. Jepsen said more important than the $105,000 was the agreement by CVS to offer consumers a $2 discount coupon toward any purchase for each expired over-the-counter drug, baby food or formula, egg or dairy product that a consumer finds on store shelves and turns in to cashiers. Those coupons will be distributed for the next three years. Consumers do not have to make a purchase to receive the coupon and there is no limit on the number of coupons a consumer can receive. Investigators for Blumenthal found expired products at 20 of 45 Connecticut CVS stores visited in the spring and summer of 2009, among them stores in Avon, Berlin, Cheshire, Meriden, Newington, Old Saybrook and Rocky Hill. The suit asked for $5,000 for each deliberate violation of the law. At $105,000, which is about one-eighth the settlement of a similar suit reached in New York, that would amount to about 25 violations. As part of the settlement, CVS must begin a program of regular inspections of covered products.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Re-Launches Caremark.com for PBM Members
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation has re-launched Caremark.com for the company's pharmacy benefit management, or PBM, members. The updated website unveils a new look to the site as well as enhanced functionality to provide members with an on-line destination which can help them quickly and easily manage their prescription benefits. The updated site is written in straight-forward, easy to understand language, includes an updated and improved registration process and has enhanced site navigation.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report April,2011  Sales/Trading Statement Results on May 04, 2011
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report April, 2011  sales/trading statement results on May 04, 2011

Key Development Headline: Walgreens Introduces Daily Testing for Cholesterol, Blood Glucose and A1C
Key Development Situation: Further expanding the scope of convenient, preventive health care services provided by its pharmacists, Walgreen Co. is now offering daily testing for total cholesterol and HDL (high-density lipoprotein), blood glucose and A1C at more than 1,400 pharmacies in 33 states, as well as Washington, D.C. Each test also includes a free blood pressure reading and personal consultation with a Walgreens pharmacist.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Plans to Permanently Lay Off 250 Employees
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation plans to permanently lay off 250 employees from its call center at 1300 E. Campbell Road in Richardson. The layoffs will result from a restructuring of CVS Caremark's operations. The company will close the call center and consolidate those functions at other call centers throughout the country. The lay-offs are scheduled over a two-week window beginning June 30. Some employees may be given a chance to stay with the company in other positions, but the company has not yet decided the identity or number of employees who may stay on.

Key Development Headline: Health Management Associates Inc. Appoints Kerrin E. Gillespie in Role of Senior Operating Finance
Key Development Situation: Radiation Therapy Services Holdings Inc. announced the resignation of its Chief Financial Officer, Kerrin E. Gillespie, effective May 16, 2011. Mr. Gillespie will be assuming a senior operating finance role at Health Management Associates Inc., where he previously held various roles in operations and finance.

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Inc. Appoints Robert Yungk as Chief Strategy Officer Effective from May 2011
Key Development Situation: Amedisys Inc. announced that Robert Yungk, a principal with Corporate Health Strategies, LLC, will join the company as its new chief strategy officer in May 2011. In this new role, Mr. Yungk will be leading the company's focus on diversifying its revenue model by engaging hospitals, managed care providers and Accountable Care Organizations regarding the value of home health care and hospice to their patients. He will also be responsible for overseeing home care and hospice business development as well as supporting corporate development efforts. Mr. Yungk joins the company from Corporate Health Strategies, LLC, where he served as a principal and strategy consultant to early phase private equity.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Announces New Medical Benefit Drug Management Service for PBM Clients
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced a new medical benefit drug management service for the company's pharmacy benefit management, or PBM, and specialty pharmacy clients. The offering is to provide a comprehensive management solution for the buy-and-bill drug model currently used by physicians. The payer-centric offering will employ both prospective and retrospective drug utilization management strategies to drugs billed under the medical benefit, while ensuring minimal disruption to the physician's workflow and facilitating the delivery of evidence-based care. The company will work with New Century Health, a specialty care management company, to offer its clients integrated evidence-based medicine, treatment care pathways, quality improvement programs, and peer-to-peer review through an innovative web-based decision support platform. This offering will be broadly available to CVS Caremark customers for implementation beginning January 1, 2012. This offering will enable CVS Caremark to identify the unrecognized specialty pharmacy spend currently billed through the medical benefit for oncology patients.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark to Pay $17.5 Million to Resolve Reimbursement Complaint
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corp. agreed to pay a fine of $17.5 million to resolve a civil complaint alleging its pharmacies for overbilling reimbursement claims from state Medicaid programs. CVS said the settlement amount had already been accounted for in prior fiscal periods and will not impact future earnings. CVS Caremark reached the $17.5 million settlement with the U.S. Department of Justice, the Office of Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services, and a number of state Attorneys General. The settlement amount is to be allocated among the federal government and ten states. The civil complaint relates to how CVS/retail pharmacies submitted inflated prescription claims to the government by billing the Medicaid programs for more than what CVS was actually owed for drugs dispensed to Medicaid beneficiaries, who were also eligible for benefits under a primary third party insurance plan.

Key Development Headline: Amedisys Supports Department of Health and Human Services' New Partnership for Patients
Key Development Situation: Amedisys supports the Department of Health and Human Services' (HHS) newly formed Partnership for Patients program, and will join the initiative. The program, which is a joint partnership between hospitals, providers and other health care agencies, is designed to increase patient safety while simultaneously lowering costs to the health care system.

Key Development Headline: Amedisys, Inc. Standardizes on Oracle's PeopleSoft Enterprise 9.1 to Improve Back-Office Efficiency and Support Sustained Rapid Growth
Key Development Situation: Amedisys Inc. has standardized on Oracle's PeopleSoft Enterprise 9.1 for Human Capital Management (HCM), Financial Management and Supply Chain Management (SCM). By consolidating five disparate legacy systems onto a single integrated platform, Amedisys is streamlining the flow of information across its enterprise -- which includes 17,000 employees and more than 577 care centers -- and is positioned to reduce IT overhead and administrative costs. The integrated solution has eliminated the need to re-enter information into various siloed systems, enabling Amedisys to focus staff on strategic priorities. The new system also provides the scalability needed to support the company's rapid growth driven by numerous strategic acquisitions. PeopleSoft Time and Labor enables Amedisys to support flexible work schedules for its caregivers and meet the complex payroll requirements associated with this business model, including the ability to pay nurses per patient visit. Expanded self-service capabilities provide greater employee convenience by enabling them to enter time and expenses, and manage personal information via a portal, helping reduce the administrative requirements of the HR team. Amedisys has achieved end-to-end integration of its supply chain with PeopleSoft SCM applications. By integrating PeopleSoft SCM and Amedisys' proprietary applications, it is optimizing the purchase of critical supplies and ensuring that they are onsite when and where they are needed for care delivery and continuity of business operations. PeopleSoft Enterprise Financial Management has expanded Amedisys' visibility into financial data from the center-level to the enterprise level.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Helps NRG Energy, Inc. to Launch the Nation's First Privately Funded and Comprehensive Electric Vehicle Charging Station Network
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. helped launch the nation's first privately funded and comprehensive electric vehicle charging network with an initial station at the Walgreens drugstore at Belt Line Road and Montfort Drive in Dallas. Walgreen is working with NRG Energy Inc. to install high-powered rapid charging eVgosm Freedom Stations at 18 locations across the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex. NRG plans to install at least 30 charging stations at public parking facilities, other retailers and workplaces throughout the area by Labor Day. The charging stations will be conveniently located along major freeways, near retail districts and in multi-family communities. Walgreens is the largest retailer participating in this program. The charging stations will feature a high-speed direct current (DC) charger that can add 30 miles of range in as little as 10 minutes of charging time, along with a Level 2 charger that can add up to 25 miles of range per hour of charge. The stations are strategically located across eVgo host partner cities to provide comprehensive coverage throughout the region. By the end of 2012, NRG plans to install a total of approximately 70 charging stations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and another 50 in the Houston area. Additionally, NRG plans will help electrify the Interstate 45 corridor that connects the two cities by the end of next year. Last November, Walgreens announced plans to host eVgo charging stations at 18 initial sites throughout Houston. Construction began this month at two locations.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. to Report March,2011  Sales/Trading Statement Results on Apr 05, 2011
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that they will report March, 2011  sales/trading statement results on Apr 05, 2011

Key Development Headline: Hanger Orthopedic Group Inc. to Approve the Amendment to its Certificate of Incorporation
Key Development Situation: Hanger Orthopedic Group Inc. announced that at the annual general meeting to be held on May 12, 2011, to approve an amendment to the company's Certificate of Incorporation, as amended, providing for the removal of the class of Non-Voting Common Stock; to approve an amendment to the company's Certificate of Incorporation, as amended, to permit amendments to the company's By-Laws by its Board of Directors; and to approve an amendment to the company's Certificate of Incorporation, as amended, to remove duplicative provisions and make certain other non-substantive changes.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Appoints Helena B. Foulkes as Executive Vice President & Chief Health Care Strategy and Marketing Officer
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation announced that it has named Helena B. Foulkes to the newly created position of Executive Vice President & Chief Health Care Strategy and Marketing Officer. In the new role Foulkes will bring together the company's capabilities in enterprise branding, communications, community relations, charitable giving, health care reform strategy, government relations and marketing into one integrated organization to deliver even better business results and stronger partnerships.

Key Development Headline: Independent Pharmacists Support Lawsuit Against CVS Caremark Corporation
Key Development Situation: Community pharmacists nationwide are stepping up to financially support six Independent pharmacists in Texas in their legal battle with CVS Caremark Corporation. The six plaintiff pharmacies are all board members of American Pharmacies, a multi-state member-owned independent pharmacy cooperative. Nationwide, individuals and pharmacy organizations are donating $50 to $15,000 to the American Pharmacies Legal Defense Fund. After months of pressure from unions, consumers, lawmakers, and the National Community Pharmacists Association, the Federal Trade Commission initiated a non-public review of the $27 billion merger in August, 2009. The plaintiff pharmacies complain CVS Caremark misuses private business and patient data to target pharmacies for takeover. They assert these actions are ongoing criminal practices constituting racketeering. The plaintiffs seek treble damages for the RICO violations, as well as an injunction barring CVS Caremark's practices in the future. The trade secret misappropriation claim includes a request for exemplary damages. The plaintiff pharmacies are: Rogers Pharmacy, Victoria; Brookshire Bros. Pharmacy of Kirbyville; Hometown Pharmacy, Fairfield; Hibbs Pharmacy, Bay City; Kinsey's Pharmacy, Tyler; and De La Rosa Pharmacy, Weslaco. The plaintiffs' attorneys in this matter include Donald R. Taylor and Miguel S. Rodriguez of Taylor Dunham, LLP. The suit is filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Texas in Victori Published by HT Syndication with permission from Daily Pak Banker.

Key Development Headline: Negligence Action Against Walgreen Co. Dismissed on Statute of Limitations Grounds
Key Development Situation: The Eleventh U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals affirmed a district court's dismissal on statute of limitations grounds of a negligence action brought against Walgreen Co. Nellie Arrington representing the estate of her deceased mother, Ella Church, sued Walgreen Co. alleging professional malpractice by filling a prescription for medicine to which Church was allergic. A district court granted summary judgment in favor of Walgreen after concluding that the action was barred under an applicable two-year statute of limitations, and Arrington appealed. The Eleventh Circuit noted that, under applicable precedent, the cause of action accrued upon the discovery of the injury, which occurred more than two years prior to the commencement of the action.

Key Development Headline: HCA, Inc. Announces Board Appointments
Key Development Situation: HCA, Inc. announced that Jay O. Light, Dean Emeritus of Harvard Business School, and Geoffrey G. Meyers, retired Chief Financial Officer of Manor Care, have been elected to HCA's board as independent directors, effective March 9. With the additions, HCA's board of directors grows from 13 to 15. Collectively, the two bring more than 55 years of professional experience. Light is the George F. Baker Professor of Administration Emeritus for Harvard Business School in addition to the school's Dean Emeritus. Meyers was CFO, Executive Vice President and Treasurer for Manor Care from 1988 until 2006. Before joining Manor Care, he held a number of leadership positions at Owens-Illinois, including CFO of the company's Health Care Division, during a 20-year career there.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Names Joseph Magnacca as New President of Daily Living Products and Solutions
Key Development Situation: Walgreen Co. announced that Joseph Magnacca will become the company's new President of Daily Living Products and Solutions. In his new role Magnacca will oversee Walgreens marketing and merchandising operations led by Chief Marketing Officer, Kim Feil and Chief Merchandising Officer, Bryan Pugh. In addition, Magnacca will continue to lead the integration of the Duane Reade drugstores, which Walgreens acquired in April 2010. In his expanded role, Magnacca will bring together Walgreens marketing and merchandising functions to help enhance and carry out the company's strategy to be America's first choice for health and daily living. A retail industry veteran of more than 20 years, Magnacca served as vice president of marketing and merchandising for Loblaw, Canada's leading food distributer and provider of general merchandise products and services, and as executive vice president of merchandising and category management for Shoppers Drug Mart, the largest drug chain in Canada. In 2008, Joe joined Duane Reade as senior vice president and chief merchandising officer. He was subsequently promoted to executive vice president at Duane Reade and then to president of the New York-based drugstore chain following its acquisition by Walgreens. In his new role, he will continue to report to President and CEO Greg Wasson.

Key Development Headline: CVS Caremark Corporation Elects Tony L. White to its Board
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corporation elected Tony L. White to serve on the Board. Mr. White, age 64, is the former Chairman of the Board, President and Chief Executive  Officer  of  Applied Biosystems,  Inc. Mr.  White is currently a director of Ingersoll-Rand plc.

Key Development Headline: Arthur Steinberg and the Philadelphia Federation of Teachers Health and Welfare Fund. Sue CVS Caremark Corporation for Using Patient Drug Data
Key Development Situation: CVS Caremark Corp. has been sued over claims that it used confidential prescription information to push products on behalf of pharmaceutical makers. CVS violated the privacy and rights of consumers by sending letters to customers' physicians that promoted specific medications, according to a complaint filed this week in state court in Philadelphia. CVS allegedly identified consumers by name, date of birth and medications taken, drawing on information obtained through CVS pharmacy services. CVS was paid for the promotion of competing drugs by Merck & Co., AstraZeneca Plc and Bayer AG, according to the complaint filed by Richboro, Pa., resident Arthur Steinberg and the Philadelphia Federation of Teachers Health and Welfare Fund. CVS has been plagued by privacy concerns since its purchase of Caremark Rx Inc. for about $22 billion in 2007. Steinberg's LAWsuit follows a similar complaint filed in September by a group of Texas pharmacies accusing the company of violating privacy and racketeering laws.

Key Development Headline: Walgreen Co. Becomes New Member of Care Continuum Alliance
Key Development Situation: The Care Continuum Alliance announced its newest member Walgreen Co. The Care Continuum Alliance, an international trade association, represents more than 200 organizations and individuals providing services across the continuum of care -- from wellness and prevention to chronic condition management and complex care management. Through advocacy, research and education, the Care Continuum Alliance promotes evidence-based strategies to improve health care outcomes and reduce avoidable care costs. The Care Continuum Alliance has focused considerable effort in recent years on improving employee health and productivity, particularly through research on outcomes measurement. Its Outcomes Guidelines project has produced consensus clinical and financial measures for wellness and population health management programs, as well as guidance on other key outcomes, such as medication adherence. The Care Continuum Alliance also has advocated successfully for greater support of wellness and prevention in federal programs and in the private market.
